Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate waste of money!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ObjectiveBigSpender
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel under luxury hotel and resort collection. We have NEVER had a bad experience with that company until now. Booked the hotel based on the pool/pool bar. Arrived and the pool bar doesn't open until 3 pm (not mentioned when I called the hotel directly and... Who is laying by the pool only after 3 pm?!?!) AND the pool was closed for a "photo shoot" that took up the whole pool for a majority of the afternoon. Furthermore, room service was closed at 10 pm, front desk was unhelpful (in ordering a pizza nonetheless) and Charlie Palmer was a waste of time and energy (great staff, HORRIBLE management.) Stay at luxury hotels frequently and would recommend ANYWHERE in dallas other than this! Spend your $$$ at the W!!! Better investment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl14
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in the St. Regis in Houston prior to coming to this hotel. The Joule is not luxurious in comparison and not sure why Starwood has it branded as such. This is a W Hotel wanna-be for the over 40 set. The rooms are tiny and open like most W's and the focus on being trendy, not on customer service nor amenities. Designer soap in the bathroom does not a luxury hotel make. This hotel has a very cramped feel. Be warned, the building next door is under construction (which I am sure is temporary). It is clear this hotel has no loading dock or alley because while I was eating dinner at the award winning restaurant downstairs (Charlie Palmer's) I had big trucks pulling up within 10 ft of my table loading and unloading big crates of towels (I learned they outsource their linens) and other large pieces of equipment. It really ruined the experience for me. The pool was nice as was the fitness center but with tiny cramped rooms, lack of customer service (I tried calling the desk 3 times and never go through) and the loading dock at the front of the building, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: lcb47
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (females in our early 20's) stayed at the Joule on the night of the 7th April. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable. Check in: staff were friendly and efficient and very happy to provide recommendations for activites/meals in the local area. Room: we stayed in a Deluxe room with two double beds. The room was immaculately clean, modern and very spacious. The view left somewhat to be desired but we weren't there to look out the window. There was a very large shower but no bath. A point to note: there was no door separating the bathroom from the bedroom, instead there was a large pull-across curtain which acted almost as a room divider. There was a separate cubicle with door for the toilet. This didn't bother us too much but it was a bit of a strange arrangement, particular when the room isn't set up for couples. The beds were large and very comfortable. Pool: The pool was wonderful. There were plenty of towels and comfortable seating available and the staff couldn't do enough to help. The service was great and drinks not eye-wateringly priced. Transport: The hotel provided a courtesy car which was available to take us for dinner. The restaurant that was recommended to us for dinner was excellent but very pricey (make sure to check before accepting that this is what you're looking for). The hotel also arranged a car to take us to the airport early in the morning, which charged the same as the cabs' flat rate from the airport to downtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would stay here again if I return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “D.D. Bates "Exceptional hotel; A cut above"”
Reviews.Author: Daphine B
Reviews.Content: If first impressions are lasting then my experience at The Joule will be a pleasant memory for quite some time. The customer service, bar none,was simply the best. I received a warm welcome from the gentlemen at the front door followed by prompt and courteous service from my check-in agent Mr. Myron Robinson whose attention to detail was impressive. Every hotel should be so fortunate to have a go-to -man as personable and professional as Myron. He set the tone and the bar for the rest of the staff and they, too, exceeded my expectations. The room was on the 7th floor and I was quite pleased. I was not disturbed at all by any noise from the construction project. The bedroom could be closed off from the sitting area which included a sofa, bar area and flat screen T.V. The furnishings were upscale and comfortable. The bathroom was designed perfectly: A separate toliet area, a separate shower and my personal favorite...a jacuzzi bathtub. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of nice eating places, all types of stores and shops and entertainment establishments. I did have breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel and it was delicious. The hotel also has a nice gift shop. If you are looking to treat yourself, then look no further than The Joule!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: sanebrain
Reviews.Content: The very nicely decorated lobby says a lot about this hotel. Everything from the lobby to the rooftop pool has a very modern look. I stayed in a suite on the 9th floor and had no complaints. The furniture was nice, the bed was extremely comfortable, and I loved the lighting system.

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel in downtown dallas”
Reviews.Author: travelxpertNY
Reviews.Content: the first thing I noticed checking into our well decorated contemporary room was a note saying that construction starts at 9am on Saturday and 7am during the week. The hotel is currently being expanded so make sure that you get a room on the side of the hotel away from the construction. There is a very nice pool on the roofdeck that extends beyond the hotel wall over the street but it's not easy getting a seat if you dont get there early. The rooms don't have a bathtub so the girls might not like this hotel. The service for the most part was excellent except when we asked for an extra shampoo and they said that they charge extra for that-I thought it was a joke but he was serious, they did end up sending 2 extra for no charge. The hotel is within walking distance of the school book depository museum and the Dallas Museum of art. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and well appointed. I might wait until the new part of the hotel is finished before staying here again. The parking costs $27 per night but the WIFi is free. The hotel offers a cadillac escalade to drive you to anywhere nearby which is a nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: A great customer experience is achieved by everyone doing everything right. It can take just one person to undo it too. My wife and I stayed the weekend at the Joule for our 16th wedding anniversary. I would with out reservation give it 5 stars, everyone ....everyone we came into contact was friendly, professional and made our stay very enjoyable. From moment we checked in to the a hand written card wishing us a happy anniversary to a great dinner at Charley Palmers it was a perfect experience. Being a little jaded from regularly staying at the Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton we have high expectations, all of which were delightfully exceeded!

Reviews.Title: “Not my style”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid I found the Joule to be overrated. It seemed gimmicky rather than classy. I usually stay in the SMU area, but this time my business was in downtown Dallas, so I chose between the Joule and the nearby Adolphus. Some reviews said the rooms at the Adolphus need renovation, so I chose the Joule. Unfortunately, the Joule seems to be one of those hotels that strive to be trendy rather than aiming for something more important. Very low light in the elevators, whose walls are decorated with jazzed-up prints of what at first glance appear to be photographs of bats or extraterrestrials but upon closer examination turn out to be deer. There is not much light in the guest rooms either; even after I had figured out the modernistic multi-setting light buttons I couldn't get them bright enough to see very well. I'm pretty sure this is intentional. And one of the signs leading to the pool says "Poule". As in many hotels that are funky and proud of it, there was not enough attention to the fundamentals of customer care. I had asked for a quiet room on a high floor, and although I did get a high floor my room was directly across from the elevator and my window overlooked the construction site where the hotel is apparently building a new wing. Construction starts at 7 a.m. This wasn't a problem for me because I had early meetings both days, but most luxury hotels would hold off until a bit later in the morning. And my wake-up call the first morning came 30 minutes late. (When I asked what had happened, the young lady apologized.) There's an exercise room with good equipment but not enough of it. At 5 p.m. there were a couple of guests waiting for others to finish on the three treadmills. And there is a partial set of Nautilus-style weight machines, somewhat fewer than in most high-end hotels and omitting several basic exercises. It wasn't all bad. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and most of the staff -- particularly the housekeeping staff -- were courteous and efficient. I liked the Bulgari shampoo and the chocolates on my pillow. So if self-consciously high-tech hotels are your style, you'll probably like the Joule. But I wish I'd tried the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Ahmazingly cool and modern roo”
Reviews.Author: jasper15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very posh and modern. We loved the auto curtains and bathroom facilities. I felt like we were in a clean and futuristic hotel. the balcony was so cute, had a little picnic table with a great view of the city. ah if only we had more time. I would love for more hotels like the joule to be around when i visit different places. hotel service was wonderful. parking is a bit expensive but what do you expect in downtown... we did find a parking garage a couple of blocks on elm street. it looked closed but we pushed the ticket and open sesame! parking was $10/day. jackpot.

Reviews.Title: “Make Sure to Get a Drink from Mauricio Before You Checkout”
Reviews.Author: xaiver56
Reviews.Content: The Joule is certainly a beautiful hotel and the staff is great. However if you really want to enjoy your stay you have to stop by the bar when Mauricio is working. He makes some of the best drinks around and if you don't know what you are in the mood for he can create a cocktail you are sure to enjoy. Last time I was there I enjoyed a Moscow Mule, which is a can't miss in my opinion. I am sure I will be visiting the Joule again, just for the service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond- Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Business1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Joule for 4 nights at the beginning of February along with 8 other colleagues. ARRIVAL Arrived at the hotel early (around 11am) and was greeted by the door staff asking for my last name and already taking my luggage out of the cab. Was quikcly escorted with my bag to the front desk where they already had my reservation information pulled up and had started my check in. Had booked a Deluxe room and was automatically upraded to a Grand Deluxe at check in (hotel was not too busy it seemed on this particular wekened). After finishing check in, bellman already had my lugagge ready to go and an elevator waiting. ROOM Room was very spacious and well laid out. I liked how the working area was seperate from the bedroom so i didnt have to stare at all my work materials, etc while relaxing/watching tv etc. Amenities in teh room were very modern, multiple light dimmers, BOSE ipod player with remote, digital thermostat (2) and great new flat screen TV. Washroom area was well designed and spacious with seperate toilet area which is always nice. Shower was wonderful with 2 options, rain and wand. Decor was very modern and reminded me of an upscale W hotel but with a more refined and muted color palette. Bulgari amenities were a plus and always plenty of soft fluffy towels which is always nice! SERVICE Staff really made this hotel stand out that extra bit. They greated our group each morning and remembered all of our names, even with 9 of us! Used their in house car service (escalade) to go for a quick 5 minute errand. Driver was quite an interesting character and made the ride enjoyable. Escalade was new and in top shape. F&B At both at the Charlie Palmer restaurant and room service. Room service was quick and food was quite good. On par with other 4-5* hotels I have stayed out. The Charlie Palmer restaurant is what really stood out. I ate alone the first night as my colleagues arrived the next day. I called the concierge to ask for a reservation and they took care of it quickly. When I arrived they were ready with a nice table for me and greeted me by name. Restaurant was above attentive and i could tell were trying to keep me company by chatting/etc. Food was above fantastic (although you will pay). The chef sent out a complimentary amuse bouche and at the end a nicely wrapped bag of fresh gingersnap cookies to take back with me to my room. Overall I would not hesitate to recommend or stay at the Joule again next time I am back in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: hjg61
Reviews.Content: The Joule was a great hotel to stay at in Dallas. When we first arrived there was tea and cookies in the lobby waiting for all of the guest, with a fantastic array of decorations in the lobby. When we spoke to one of the front desk clerks they said it used to be a bank and it was to be designed along the lines of natural elements such as wind and water. When we got to our room it was very modern and high tech with all of the light switches and lamp knobs. However, we didn't reserve a handicap room but got oen anyway with two beds. The shower was GREAT, the beds were GREAT but the view was looking at airconditioners which didn't bother us because we weren't looking out that much. Also the maids probably need to consider dusting in the bathroom lights becuase they were covered in dust! We ate breakfest downstairs at Charlie Palmer which was one of the best hotel breakfest experiences I have ever had. The service was amazing and the food was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Vickinbobyo
Reviews.Content: First I want to say the staff was great, and did try to help out where they could. Our first room was called a Demi Joule, what a mistake. We are Starwood members so I asked for an upgrade which normally I do not have to ask, but they said they were fully booked and that's the room I booked so that's what you get, but said they would upgrade us the next day. Now I knew it was 212 sq ft but I did not know that half of the square feet was bathroom. It has a round bed, my husband is over six feet tall so has to sleep in the middle of the bed or his feet hang over the edge, He has a seven hour meeting scheduled the next morning so needs his sleep. I am sleeping to his right with my feet hanging over the end of the bed and cannot get out because there are drawers in the way so to get out I have crawl over the end of the bed. We go to sleep, at six in the morning construction starts below our room, with sewer gases, yelling construction workers and beeping trucks. There is nothing on their website informing you that there is construction going on at this hotel and nothing is mentioned when we checked in and the windows do not fit correctly and are impossible to close all the way. Our room is right over the construction site, I booked this room over a month ago and I thought being a starwood member meant something, I find a small note on the desk in the morning saying that construction starts at seven. My husband decides to iron his shirt before his meeting, once the ironing board is up I cannot get to the bathroom. And this is a $300 room. The room is tacky all it needs is a pole for pole dancing. My husband goes off to his meeting with lack of sleep. They move us around noon. Nicer room the size of a normal hotel room. The windows in this room do not close correctly either, but we are not over the construction site, so cannot wait for a good night sleep. WRONG! We are awaken by motorcycle races at one in the morning. I call down to the front desk and ask "Don't you have police in this State?" I am informed it is not against the law to have motorcycle races at this time of the morning. My husband has another long day of meetings with no sleep. When he gets back we both work on the windows and finally after he stands on the ledge of the window and puts all his weight on windows gets them to close all the way, I wonder how they expect a woman to do this. The bathrooms, who ever designed them should be shot, I know the dim light looks cool, but it would be nice to be able to shave or put makeup on in the morning. The mirror is on one side and the sink on the other side of the counter, so if you are a man trying to shave you have to keep walking from mirror to sink. I believe charging $15-$20 for a glass of wine that has been opened for over 24 hours (not gassed) and not offering to open you a new bottle is a rip off. This is a Charlie Palmer restaurant and he should know better. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ryan A
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided on this hotel for a short weekend trip to Dallas. From the pictures posted online we thought we were in for a treat. Don't let the historic/old look of this hotels exterior fool you. The inside is very modern and sleek. Very intimate. We stayed in the Penthouse Suite and the service and the room was perfect. The bathroom was clean and beautiful. The master bedroom was beautiful, comfortable and had great views of downtown Dallas. If you are headed to Dallas this is a great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Artsy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiMartinoM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property the day before Valentines with my wife. We were impressed with how intimate and different this hotel is. It is definitely worth checking out while in Dallas. The decor is artsy and modern, great location, in a historic building. The room was beautifully appointed with a round bed, bvlagari amenities, rainfall shower, and oversized flat screen. The room was surprisingly small and the bed was terrible, i liked the idea of a round bed as it is unique but it was very awkward and felt cheap..not a luxury collection standard. We used the house car, a Cadillac Escalade which took us around, nice touch but the car wasnt as clean as it should have been and the driver didnt seem like he wanted to take us. Other than that no complaints, beautiful pool on the 10th floor and up to date fitness center with bottles of water and fruit. The Joule really is a gem and I would return but probably would opt for a different room catogory

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BooTheGroundhog
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. The theme throughout is engineering / ingenuity and you can see it in very fine details. All of the details stood up to scrutiny, even to an engineer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Restaurant and Bar”
Reviews.Author: Alexis V
Reviews.Content: For Xmas, my husband and I decided to book a suite at the Joule. Great idea. The suite was wonderful. Clean. The bathroom was beautiful with a large soaking tub, a shower room and excellent lighting. It was incredibly trendy and modern without being intimidating and cold. I can't get over the bathroom. It was so nice!!! Also, it was very nice to be next door to Neiman Marcus. The staff was excellent and even helped us get on the VIP list at a club. Anything we asked for was done. At first, I did not want to eat at the restaurant. I'm a simple southern girl and don't like anything too 'frou frou', but the waiter was incredibly patient and courteous. The bartenders were atttentive. Would I stay here again? In a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: YinzerHoagies
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a quick weekend trip to Dallas to catch up with friends and catch a Stars hockey game. We wound up staying at the Joule and were blown away. The service was top notch from the minute we pulled up front and were greeted by the valet. We were in a hurry to get over to the American Airlines Center, as the hockey game was just about to start as soon as we got into town, so after we quickly dropped off our bags, we took advantage of the Joule's courtesy driver and were quickly chauffeured there in time to see the puck drop. It was a nice day so we opted to walk back after the game as it's only about a mile away. The room was stayed in was very chic yet amazingly comfortable. High end details throughout the room and a very comfortable bed. My girlfriend got a chance to enjoy a soak in the jacuzzi bathtub, but I, being over 6'4, was partial to the rain shower head in the shower which I could stand (upright) under WITH ROOM TO SPARE (this rarely happens for me). Checkout was a breeze and we got a couple of complementary waters for the road as well as some of their hand lotion which the girlfriend was addicted to by the time we left. For our next stay we need to remember to bring swimwear so we can take advantage of the rooftop pool and poolside bar, which looked like it had a fun vibe to it. Next time we're in Dallas we'll definitely be staying at Joule again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, FANTASTIC SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Sonia P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Joule this weekend for a one night getaway. Pulled up on the drive and Raul was there to greet us with a warm welcome! He was so delightful to talk to, he gave us recommendations to nearby places and directed us to the Front Desk where we were greeted by another friendly face. The front desk agent, I think his name was Ben, was so polite and sweet and our check in process went really well. At night, Andrew was our driver and he was the absolute best. He took us to the best places with no hesitation and our communication was perfect. Dropped us off, picked us up and had the best conversations with him about Dallas nightlife! Last but not least, I'd like to give a shout out to the Front Desk Supervisor, Levi Krehbiel. He was nice enough to upgrade us to a beautiful suite and send up a bottle of bubbly! Made our getaway even better! Kudos to the staff who gave such lovely service. We love the Joule and will most definitely be back! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “The joule was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: KtKTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Joule In late January. We stayed in a deluxe room. It was by no means big, but it was perfect for two. We both loved the shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We used the free car service several times and the drivers all had great recommendations for places to go and to eat. We wish the weather had been warmer so we could have tried out the pool. My only complaint about our room was that one side faced east and the bathroom window was not adequately covered so the morning sun lit up the whole room. Not great if you're trying to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Only a fool would book the Joule”
Reviews.Author: gavinchambers
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Joule. We certainly did not get recognised for an upgrade as a Starwood Gold Member. This hotel would have been adequate if the room price was much less. You get no view . I opened my curtains to a view of the construction site. We complained and they just moved us to an even smaller room with the same view. The staff are all young and good looking with little knowledge of service expectations. The gym is in desperate need of an upgrade. I was so amazed at the rust on the equipment. I took a photo of it with my camera. I have stayed in the finest resorts in the world and Starwood has placed this hotel in their Luxury Collection. It needs to be removed ASAP. It might be where the young people of Texas go to spend their money on dinner and drinks in the bar but its not the place to stay overnight. The only service which was spot on was the car parking service and staff. The turn down service was another amazing experience. I had a rather loud banging on my door to find a maid who said (Who spoke little english) 'downturn you have ice". She then handed me a bag , yes a bag of ice. I took it with astonishment.. if ice is all the guests want from this hotel it says it all about the culture this hotel is trying to achieve. No refund on items we complained about.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen0155
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central around the bars and restaurants, and only 10 min. walk from the JFK museum. Certainly 5 Star, the quality of the fittings and furnishings is very high in all areas of the hotel and function rooms. Food was delicious. The most outstanding thing about this hotel was the customer service. Everybody was extremely helpful and pleasant no matter what their role was. I would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, intimate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mymothersbuttons
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving the tone was very distinguished and sophisticated. The decor and lighting was over the top sexy. I would say it seemed more like a gentleman's hotel, which was confirmed when I saw the focus on the bathroom reading material display. The amenities from the Bose sound system to the toiletries were very upscale and the service was wonderful. Great bedding, very quiet room, and no light peeking through the drapes which meant a great nights sleep every night. Ben made dinner reservations for us at Nick and Sam's (a must go to restaurant) and we were treated like VIP's, with several comp. appetizers. One draw back was the impractical lighting in the bathroom, it was very difficult to apply make up in the morning. A SPG upgrade would have been nice. Overall 4+ stars!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nychellzkitchen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel... very chic room interior with lots of beautiful furnishes... service was not 5 star or what I expected from this level of a hotel(maybe I spend too much time in Asia). While I think the hotel is great the location in Downtown Dallas is not great. There is nothing to do around there besides go to Neiman Marcus and a few restaurants. Beautiful decor but lacks 5 star service... maybe I expect more out of this property but for the price paid for a Dallas Hotel I expected the service to be on the same level. The hotel looks like it belongs in Asia or some FAB European city but the service is very Dallas... Meaning the service just did not live up to the interior of the hotel. This hotel seems like a platinum W...

Reviews.Title: “Very good chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: astronomer_chicago
Reviews.Content: The Joule is certainly amongst the best hotels within the SPG system. Stayed here for a few days for business last year. And I canâ€™t wait to go back Good: â€¢ Amazing dÃ©cor throughout the hotel. From the lobby to the rooms, this hotel has been very tastefully decorated â€¢ Rooms â€“ Very chic rooms. Bose iPod docs. High quality toiletries. Admittedly the open bathroom concept may not suit a lot of people so be aware â€¢ Food â€“ Charlie Palmer is a very very good restaurant. The salmon here is especially good â€¢ Service â€“ Very good and the staff are very friendly. This extends to the restaurants as well Bad: â€¢ No parking within the hotel itself so if you do not wish to pay for valet parking you have to drive around to a nearby parking building â€¢ No upgrades for SPG Platinum members â€“ although since I was travelling for business, I didnâ€™t particularly care. The standard rooms are nice enough Overall, this is a fantastic hotel and certainly one of the best in SPG in North America. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: italia071
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Joule, and I would not classify it as a 5 star hotel. The house car was unavailable at most times. We called to reserve, but were told that it was on a first come, first serve basis and that we need to call 15 minutes in advance. When we did call 15 minutes in advance we were then told that the car was booked for the next hour and a half. The staff at night seemed more concerned about the customers at the club than they did about the customers at the hotel. They rushed to open the door for those going to the club, but let it slam in our face. I'm sure that they were their regulars, but 5 star hotels treat everyone like a VIP. I've stayed at many 5 star hotels, and the difference between a five and four star is the service. It is not uncommon at a 5-star hotel to be greeted by name. The staff was not up to 5 star standards. If you are accustomed to the Four Seasons, Fairmont properties, or the Ritz this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniH
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing, they are beautifully decorated and appointed, the room I stayed in had 2 TVs a 55â€� in the main room and a behind the mirror variety in the bathroom. The shades are electrical and the lights all have dimming features. The beds are comfortable and come with quality linen. This hotel uses Bvlgari for its toiletry items. Service was amazing, all the staff greeted you by name and if you needed something whether it was available at the hotel or not, they will get it for you. This is a must stay hotel, next to Neiman Marcus, close to the arts district, and city parks.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: kutoff
Reviews.Content: I travel at least once a month for work, and I was fortunate enough to stay at this hotel last February and it's such a charming hotel. The staff are courteous and professional, without overdoing it. The design and decor is incredible. The have really nice turn down service, too. The hotel and guest rooms are cozy without feeling too small. I would never hesitate to return to this hotel. I hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Kiley S
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to have a fun girls weekend away in Dallas and one of the hotels we'd heard was great was the Joule. Our stay ended up being way more than great. Once we got there, we ended up hardly leaving our hotel the entire 3 nights/4 days we were there over New Years Eve, as we loved our room and the hotel so much. We enjoyed the Charlie Palmer for dinner and drinks nightly, and were treated like VIP's everywhere we went. Todd at the Charlie Palmer bar was the best - our trip wouldn't have been the same without him. We experienced true Southern hospitality from Todd and the rest of the incredible staff our entire trip. Because of our time at the Joule and the incredible people, we are already planning our next trip back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled the world and this worst experience ever!,”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttravellersww
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over world and this was one of the worst experiences, and that is rating this hotel against much cheaper ones. We only stayed one night and had so many issues. My patience was def tested at this hotel at the incompetence incurred. Firstly our room smelt of smoke so they had to come spray the room, then there wasnt a hairdryer so they came and provided that, then the tv didn't work so they they had to come fix that, then we paid for valet at $27 for our car to be returned with bird droppings all over it. Wait it gets better! Then upon check out our bill was suppose to be for $320 but they charged $388, they claimed it was a hold authorization...I've never had a hotel do that upon checkout. They finally corrected that charge, but now 2 days later they have charged a separate additional charge of $121! So I called AGAIN to ask why, they said it was for mini bar. We went out for dinner and then straight to sleep, then left early in morning bc construction noise woke us up, so we didn't have time to eat anything from mini bar. Plus my husband doesn't drink and I'm 6 mths pregnant, so pretty sure we didn't access any alcohol at the mini bar. They havent offered any sort of compensation or lousy apology. Still waiting for this latest issue to be resolved after being trf to 3 ppl at the hotel. Absolutely ridiculous service for any hotel let alone one u pay $300+ a night for. Save yourself the trouble and stay elsewhere. I'm spending more time sorting out issues than the time we spent in the room. I've never written a review but want to save ppl this drama, thanks the joule for totally ruining our first wedding anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gem in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: LaurathePowers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Joule on New Year's Eve. It's a fantastic hotel that bridges the style of the W with a world class luxury hotel. The rooms aren't huge, but they are flawless. The decor is stylish and trendy. We stayed on the 6th floor. The views weren't great, but I didn't expect much since the hotel is located in a downtown area. Parking is pain. The Joule doesn't have it's own parking, so you either have to pay $27 for overnight valet or you have to park in a public garage and walk over (not ideal). Once you get there, many restaurants are within walking distance. The hotel has a number of amenities and caters to those with discriminating tastes. If you are traveling to Dallas or just want a special night out, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ReneLD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Joule and had an excellent time. The staff is excellent and did everything possible to ensure we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Dallas near several shops and restaurants. Our suite was quiet and nicely appointed. We had drinks at the hotel bar and dinner at Charlie Palmers. We recommend both. We truly appreciate everything the staff did to ensure our visit was special. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the W”
Reviews.Author: Don K
Reviews.Content: The Joule in Dallas is a great downtown hotel. It is hip, but not over the top like the W. The service is excellent. The restaurant and bar provide a great environment fr business entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: JCBauza
Reviews.Content: You can read more about it on my blog: http://travel.bauzas.com/2011/12/21/hotel-review-united-states-of-america-texas-dallas-the-joule/. I used to stay at the W as it is a higher category but after some incidents I'm staying at the Joule from now on. I was pleased to find out it is actually a better hotel overall and sad I didn't discover this sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texastan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night for just a pre-holiday getaway. I couldn't have picked a nicer hotel for such an occasion. It started with a friendly valet staff (NOTE: you must approach the hotel from west traveling east so that you can valet. There was no self parking that I was aware of). At check-in the young lady was friendly and helpful. The host noted we were in a smaller room and volunteered to put us in a larger corner room. I never saw our original room but the one we were put in was awesome. Very modern feel and just a all around cool room. One of the coolest features about this hotel that I found was the pool. It was too cold to swim (even though the pool was heated) but the pool area is really neat. Bottom line you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dean35
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. The staff are friendly, and the location is prefect. The rooms are very comfortable, and we had free internet for our four night stay. The only criticism is that the toilet door is not fully sealed, in that it is not a full length door. This is not great! I would certianly recommend this hotel to all friends and family. The Joule has a fantastic resaurant, and there are a few nice places to eat which are really close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Travelerbmswre
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay at this property! This hotel is WONDERFUL. The Joule Suite was classy, comfortable and spacious. Great room for a relaxing weekend getaway. The decor is exceptional and very modern. The customer service was excellent and Ms. Chasity Gray was outstanding, as she went the extra mile to make sure our stay was a memorable one!!! Thank you Ms. Gray! Loved it!!! W. Edwards

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: hypedog1
Reviews.Content: This was a enjoyable place to spend the weekend . Chasity Gray helped arrange my stay at this very impressive hotel. She was very pleasant to work with and made sure my guest were comfortable throughout there stay. The decorum was awesome. Chasity actually took the time to explain the art throughout the hotel and how the owner put his own personal touch on the property. That tidbit of knowledge gave me a connection which I appreciated. Let's not forget the pool, great relaxing spot.

Reviews.Title: “TRENDY THE CARGO SHORT TSHIRT FLIPFLOP CROWD”
Reviews.Author: BIGG C
Reviews.Content: Hotel..trys to have cool art..7 year..turn around on investment..place will need total renovation, patrons are the t shirt cargo short flip flop crowd..they do not have money still paying on their 10 year old student loans...cheap, brainless, clone crowd...they will not make the place money with discounted hotel breakers selling the room..the place is a mix of IKEA AND ROOMS TO GO..........WHATS LUXURY...the patrons would not know luxury..cargo shorts, t shirts flip flops, thats LUXURY...just another trendy hotel..full of rude, cheap wannabees

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - whole area beautifully decorated for the holidays”
Reviews.Author: ModernNomad001
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with W without the attitude. This hotel is awesome. I was here on business with a client and we both totally love this place. Funky but yet classy and comfortable. Even if you just go into the lobby and get a drink at the hotel bar it is worth it. There is a giant gear in the lobby (floor to ceiling, turning another gear in the ceiling - just have to see it). You won't be sorry. See this being perfect for business (nice desk, free internet) or a romantic getaway. Puts you in the heart of Dallas close to great dining, nightlife, shopping and culture. As a bonus it is a Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Think The W - without the attitude!”
Reviews.Author: stefanwt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is EXCELLENT! I had a bit of an issue when I checked in (personal) but the front desk staff were amazing! They saw to it that my stay wouldn't be messed up and worked it out. I got a Joule suite with was very spacious and clean. I loved the bathroom and all the Bvlgari products. I wanted to take full advantage of the Jacuzzi but there was an issue with it. I reported it to the front desk and they asked if I'd like to change rooms. The manager even walked out to my car and said it would be no issue to do that. Strange though, I was transferred to the exact same room category which I had paid for but the rooms were very different (just and observations) Spent sometime at the pool bar and they bartenders were both super friendly. Ordered room service for breakfast both mornings and both times, it arrived way before they promised. The food selection was great! Stay here if you are planning on being in the downtown Dallas area!!!! Period!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: backcat20
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay with my mother here. The staff was wonderful, the food waS great, the room was lovely...

Reviews.Title: “The Poule Bar”
Reviews.Author: Kurt K
Reviews.Content: Staggering views and exceptional customer service. Staff (Jennifer, et al.) seem to have PhD's in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Best US Hotel Experiences”
Reviews.Author: jechath
Reviews.Content: I knew I was in for a treat the minute I arrived at this downtown hotel. My husband and I had arrived from an overnight flight from South America and wanted to check in really early. This was no problem at all. In no time at all we whisked to our room by one of the friendliest valets I've ever met. We were impressed by the modern design of the room. Though a bit small, it was completely wonderful. While I liked the room, I loved the shower. It was huge. It had a regular and waterfall shower head. And the bath products were Bulgari. Heavenly after a 12 hour flight. The bed was also super comfortable. The linens were very nice and the pillows were some of the best I've ever seen at a hotel. While some have complained of lighting, I liked the room could be so dark. In the middle of a sunny Dallas day, we were able to get some great sleep. The thing that made this hotel so exceptional was the staff. I have never seen a staff so determined to do such a great job. I would see some of the valets in the elevator who would recognize me and ask if I needed anything. They were all very good with directions and advice about restaurants, malls, and tourists attractions. The housekeeping staff also did a tremendous job. Our room was spotless. This is clearly a well run place that knows how to motivate its employees. I will certainly stay here again when in Dallas. I don't often travel to Dallas but hope to again soon so I can stay at The Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Best upscale, modern, unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: Msroberts3rd
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel ROCKS! As soon as you walk in, you know you are in for a great experience. The staff is A.MA.ZING. Everytime we have stayed here they have really made the experience unique and memorable. This hotel was featured on the tv show "Lonestar" by the way. We stayed here on our wedding night and it was AWESOME! We spent the rest of our honeymoon in San Francisco and even though that hotel was rated as one of the top 3 hotels in SF on trip advisor, we kept comparing it to The Joule. We came back to the hotel for our first anniversary night and, if possible, it was even better than our wedding night. For our wedding night, the staff arranged for rose petals on the bed and champagne and a cheese tray in the room. For our anniversary, rose petals throughout the suite, champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries as well as a congrats card signed by the staff. They really care about every detail of your visit and will go out of your way to recommend restaurants and accommodate you in any way they can. A specific thing we love is that all of the lights throughout your suite can be set at low, high or off. It is so night in the middle of the night to not have to use BLINDING lights on the way to the bathroom! The Poule is truly a glorious experience -- it literally hangs out over the street! AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Dallas! :)”
Reviews.Author: Noreen C
Reviews.Content: Recently, my friends and I went to The Joule for a girls night out. Upon arrival, we met Myron, the front desk agent. Myron was very charismatic, charming and hospitable. He took us to a tour of the hotel and then escorted us to The Poule. The Poule was absolutely beautiful. The view from The Poule was breathtaking. My friends and I enjoyed ourselves and also enjoyed the cocktails made by Maverick. Myron also checked in with us to make sure we were comfortable which was very thoughtful of him. My friends and I can't wait till we visit The Joule, The Poule and Myron again. Myron definitely made our experience 100 times better than what we had expected. I recommend everyone to go to The Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Joule”
Reviews.Author: stanton0918
Reviews.Content: We too stayed at The Joule for TX/OU weekend. It is one of the nicest hotels if not the nicest hotel in Dallas. The staff was wonderful and addressed our every need/request quickly. The Poule was nice with a great view of the surroundings. We didn't eat dinner at Charlie Palmer, but the Lobster and shrimp corn dog appetizers are a must try. The Jalapeno stuffed Quail Legs and Toasted Hummus were also very good. My only complaint is that we were on the 5th floor and could hear the bass of the nightclub in the basement on Saturday night....but I guess that just means I'm old. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, awesome pool, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: beachy
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed here . . . absolutely beautiful property, rooms are spacious and modern, roof-top pool area is excellent, and restaurant is 5-star. It was my birthday weekend and they sent champagne to the room - what a wonderful touch! Dinner at Charlie Palmer's was simply superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very attentive to detail!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: The employees and staff provided great service during a very busy weekend. Todd and TC at the pool went beyond in providing service to our group and me. Their hospitality was superb and made the weekend a perfect weekend for all!

Reviews.Title: “Started off rocky, ended amazing”
Reviews.Author: Marney R
Reviews.Content: Trip to this hotel started off VERY poorly with a bungled reservation. I was so livid with how it was being handled that I was ready to completely lose it. However, Shawn at the bar, Scott the restaurant's executive chef, and Todd at the hotel bar have MORE than made up for the rough start. Their understanding of customer service, above and beyond attention to detail and courtesy have made this a repeat destination on the list. As a famous restaurant critic once said, "I'll forgive a bad meal but not bad service". Thank you Shawn, Scott, and Todd for more than making up for the beginning of this trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ok amenities”
Reviews.Author: bauer_justin
Reviews.Content: I stay in Dallas quite a bit for business and this is one of two hotels I frequent (W is the other). The service at the Joule is great--everyone is also willing to help out and is very welcoming. The rooms are pretty standard for a luxury hotel; I'm SPG platinum and find I get a suite upgrade more often at the W but rarely at the Joule. The gym is okay, but somewhat small. The pool is also small, but it does have a great view of downtown. Location is good, there are lots of restaurant options nearby. Overall I'd recommend the W over the Joule but they are both great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back luxury, stellar staff”
Reviews.Author: Realist7500
Reviews.Content: Special sincere thanks to Myron, Andrew, Maverick, Clint, Nikki, Mark, and the entire Joule staff for helping make our weekend at the Joule literally perfect. Each members flawless execution in hospitality was truly extraordinary and we look forward to coming back soon. The actual property is a laid back luxurious gem and exceeded our expectations. Rooms, pool, lobby, design, etc are all well deserving of the accolades they receive. When boutique properties get it right it's a special thing - Walking away feeling fortunate just to have had the experience is why we seek out places to stay such as the Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lori V
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Joule was wonderful. The staff was terrific. We had so much fun at the Joule Poule both Saturday night and Sunday afternoon. Nikki and Maverick took such good care of us. They helped to make it a very memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Pam L
Reviews.Content: Bryce, Bryson & Nikki, they should recieve and outstanding service award. I travel with my job as well as work with high net clientele, which sometimes can be challenging to say the least. I was at the Joule for pleasure this time Bryce was my driver a couple of times, he carried on a conversation as if he had known me forever. I have not experienced that before, he was very patient, kind and accomodating. He also went on an errand for me as I was running out of time to get ready for a wedding. Bryson also has great customer service and I enjoyed visiting with Bryson on the front sidewalk several times. Nikki went out of her way to accomadate getting us some food Unfortunately she did not have enough pull to get what we needed. I suggest you take a look at the managment position as the pool ran out of Chardoney on Saturday night before 10pm and no one offered to go get us some more. I find that very unproffessional as a manager not to be stocked or offer to go get what the customer is requesting. Bryce, Bryson and Nikki were willing to do whatever it took to take care of us, they just had their hands tied and could only do so much. I think the Joule has a ways to go when it comes to the managers making the decisions. I do think it is a lovely hotel but I would like to mention the lighting in the rooms was terrible. I think you have some great staff out front you might want to have Bryce and Bryson or Nikki teach your managers what it means to have great customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Happy4Fun
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place to stay!!!!! Well worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “UBER CHIC!”
Reviews.Author: Jrent316
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel! The Bellman/Valet Team are incredible and make you feel right at home each time! Bryson (I think was his name) was so nice and made me feel right at home. Rooms are very well appointed. Best Bathroom Amenities I have ever used ... The POOL scene is incredible on the roof! Get the BURGER! Maverick was a wonderful host! Only little tiny thing is the location ... I was there on a Sunday and there's not much going on around that area, but they totally know that and offer a FREE shuttle to wherever you need to go. Can NOT wait to return! Whoever is the GM is doing an amazing job with their staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: typet032003
Reviews.Content: I often stay at great hotels, but the staff at the Joule Hotel made our stay awesome beyond belief!!! Nicole, Nikki,maverick, Todd, and Andrew made our stay memorable! I'm so grateful for they're amazing service!!! When in Dallas stay Here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: martinezh112
Reviews.Content: Walked into hotel and right away Ms victoria greeted us and walked us to the front desk and helped us check in very nice and i Loved the pool staff Nicole Nikki Todd Maverick they are so fun and great five star service from them

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: Aguerro112
Reviews.Content: I came to visit from california stayed at the Joule and i must say that i really enjoyed the stay. The pool staff Maverick, Todd, Nikki, and Nicole were amazing they treated us so well and interacted with us so well and made sure we were well taken care of. Also, Ms. Victoria whom i believe is a security guard is very nice as well always would check on us make sure we were satisfied i could not have asked for a better experience thanks to the amazing staff that i listed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Orbane2003
Reviews.Content: It started off with Virginia the security, to Tod, Nikki, Maverick, and Nicole in the pool bar. I'm still recovering from the party last night but it was DEFINITELY worth it. :D

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the pool makes this hotel worth staying!”
Reviews.Author: barbahugi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but what made it fir me was the pool staff. Nicky, Todd, maverick, and nicole are the best. They are attentive and even changed the music to our taste

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend Downtown”
Reviews.Author: jmcewen28
Reviews.Content: The Joule is one of the best hotels in downtown Dallas, the interior of the hotel is gorgeous as are the rooms. The staff was very informative on things going on downtown and in the general vicinity of the hotel. The pool with the inifinty edge over Main St was an added attraction, great place to hang out and people watch!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it - too many issues”
Reviews.Author: Suzanidoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay-cation at The Joule for our anniversary. He and I made the most of it and enjoyed our time together but for the price and all the hype, we left really wanting more. The Joule came up short on just about everything. We had multiple issues and many of the issues were further compounded by more issues. None of them in and of themselves were worthy of writing a bad review but when you add them all together, it's pretty tragic. ISSUE #1A - My husband had arranged for our favorite brand of champagne and some chocolate covered strawberries to be delivered to our room the second night, which was our anniversary. It was supposed to be a surprise...and it showed up the first night. We didn't drink it, they admitted it was their mistake. $165 surprise ruined. ISSUE #1B - They sent the bottle of champagne the second night but it showed up TWICE on our bill. Got them to take it off the bill at check out time... but really? ISSUE #2 - The concierge who my husband contacted weeks in advance of our stay made a reservation for us at the in-house restaurant, Charlie Palmer's, for our first night. My husband explained that it was a special weekend, we had friends meeting us, and we really wanted a booth. We were one of the only people in the restaurant and they seated us at THE worst table in the entire place. We asked to be moved to a corner booth - and it was perfect. The whole time my poor husband was apologizing. I guess this isn't necessarily the hotel's fault but since we had the concierge make the reservation at the hotel restaurant and there were specific requests, someone should be responsible. Not sure who they were holding the table for. Nobody sat down after us. Dinner was good but it was awfully quiet in there. ISSUE #2B - Same concierge made reservations for us at Abacus for Saturday night. Again, the restaurant tried to give us a crappy table despite husband's specific instructions to concierge that we wanted a booth in the main dining room. We waited for an hour for a good table even though we had a limo waiting on the clock. Again, not sure whose fault this is but with this being the second restaurant that said concierge was supposed to request a booth, and both times they tried to seat us at a bad table, this problem has one thing in common, the concierge. Dinner was fabulous and our waiter more than made up for the miscommunication. ISSUE #3 - We were told we needed to reserve bottle service at the PM Night Club on Thursday night if we thought we might ever want to sit down in the club. Shame on us for letting them talk us into $350 bottle service. The place was dead! We showed up at 10:30 and they sent us to a different club down the street and told us to come back after midnight if we wanted there to be more people. We did and it was still dead despite a birthday party for a 21 year old kid from SMU who had rented the Penthouse. Nice enough kid. We should have passed on the bottle service but we were told that it would pick up. Plus, we had friends with us and didn't want to make a big deal about it. The Penthouse is gorgeous. ISSUE #3B - When the bill at PM Lounge showed up it was $550 which was $200 more than we were told. Also, they didn't have Grey Goose vodka which is what we had pre-ordered. Not a big deal but when you spend that kind of money, you'd like to think things like a very standard bottle of alcohol wouldn't be an issue. Again, we had friends with us and didn't want to make a scene. Thought we could work it out in the morning. When we went to pay for the $550 tab, we asked them to put it on our hotel bill but they couldn't because that function was not working. No biggee. We paid with a credit card. Again, didn't want to make a scene and honestly just wanted to get to bed. ISSUE #3C - In the morning, my husband spoke to our concierge, told him that we were not happy for being talked into bottle service but even worse, that we were over charged. He said he would look into it and 48 hours later still did not have an answer. It took my husband bringing it to the attention of the Front Office Manager on Sunday at check out to have it addressed. We were told it would be corrected. We received a $100 for our trouble which was nice...but really? ISSUE #4 - We utilized the in-house car two times. We had a car parked in valet ($30/night) but thought the in-house car would be more convenient. We were told to call 10 minutes out which we did. Both Friday night at dinner and Saturday at lunch we waited over 30 minutes for the car to pick us up after we called. ISSUE #5 - The lighting in the room, mainly the bathroom and dressing area, is unacceptable. We had read other Trip Advisor members complain about this and we both thought they were being overly critical. How bad can lighting be in hotel of this caliber? The only light that was good for anything was in the closet so I had to get dressed and do my makeup in the closet! One other thing on the room...we had room 813 which every employee in the hotel went out of their way to tell us was really special because it had a balcony. Well, this balcony was covered with bird [--] that looked like it had been there since prohibition. So much for a nice breakfast on the terrace. There's more but honestly this is depressing me knowing how much we paid to the hotel ($3,000) and how excited we were about this trip. The one shining light at the whole place was Todd at the Poule bar. He was fabulous and absolutely perfect at his job! I would hire him in a second. I wish this made me feel better but it really hasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Jburd16
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and comfortable. The service was great. The pool was fun with amazing people watching opportunities, and I enjoyed the novelty of it being hung over the sidewalk. But after coming back to the hotel entirely exhausted I could not sleep because of the incessant thumping noises coming from cars and clubs alike. Not the hotels fault really. But if you want to sleep there ask for a room away from the street or go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Oysteria
Reviews.Content: The Joule is an absolute Jewel. It is elegant and comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms are spacious and luxurious with all the amenities you could ask for. I would recommed it to anyone that wants an elegant European hotel in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday, I made reservations at The Joule. We were treated like stars from the moment we pulled up to the valet. Our bags were brought to our room. The manager, Levi and Myron at the front desk went out of their way to help us with needs during our stay. They recommended local restaurants and entertainment locations. My wife enjoyed the entire weekend. I would definitely stay at The Joule again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than desirable experience - definitely won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, rooms are small but fine, bath products are nice. The steak house restaurant in the hotel is fine too - standard steak house. The pool doesn't get any sun until after 3pm because it's blocked by the other side of the building. And, if you want to use a lounge chair (there are only 4 chairs that aren't "Reserved") they're going to charge you $200! AND... The maid just might come into your room, while you're in there taking a nap, and STEAL your valuable jewelry from right off the table! ...Like happened to me. And good luck trying to recover anything or get any sort of apology. Unacceptable! The complimentary shuttle service might be the best part of this hotel, if that tells you anything. Won't be back. Bleh

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: LookingLooking
Reviews.Content: Great hotel interiors, dark moody decor in rooms. We stayed in a Junior Suite and it was well equipped. The actual floor space is less than other hotels, but still sufficient. Having said at, the bathroom was big, and really nice. Dark and moody still. The concierge was very helpful with organizing assistance and cars etc, by email before we arrived. The actual service at the front desk seemed a bit patchy, depending on who was there. The staff for the cars, porters and in the pool bar were all friendly and helpful. The guys dropped us at some shops, and also organized the rides too and from the hotel (with an external provider you pay direct). Overall, the hotel is good value for money, in the higher end range.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches that made it special”
Reviews.Author: travaille2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an Anniversary weekend getaway in Dallas and we were very impressed with the rooms and the service! We were treated to excellent service, including some perks at Charlie Palmer's and PM Lounge. I could not have had a more relaxing anniversary weekend. Front desk even followed up to see how everything was going with our stay. They also have an Escalade car service to take you to dinner reservations or anywhere within (I think) 5 miles of the hotel. Even with it being first come, first serve, the service only had about a 10 minute wait on a Saturday night. The room details were well thought out. Although the room we were in was a bit small, they had really nice decor and details that you would not see a Marriott or a Hilton, IMHO. The photos were interesting, the bathrooms unique, and the bed was really comfortable. It was essentially a "funky" modern look that suited us great. The only drawback was that the room faced a dilapidated building next door and they were doing construction on that side to extend the hotel (no construction noise on the weekend, just a view of the construction and rundown building!). Valet was pricey, but much preferred over worrying about my car in one of the nearby parking lots overnight. I will hopefully be back -- as the revitalized Main St. has a lot of action on the weekends and this hotel sits right in the middle! BTW, the pool and PM Lounge are really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Maverick! Good dude.”
Reviews.Author: theonlyone23
Reviews.Content: Hung out at the pool and Maverick was a great not just bartender or server, but a great personality. Looking forward to a return swim.

Reviews.Title: “Good business trip”
Reviews.Author: GettingThereisHalf
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I flew into Dallas to meet with some vendors and came across this hotel through Starwood. It is unlike any Starwood I have stayed at and we were delighted to have a boutique experience with the perks of a Starwood hotel. The rooms were pretty tight, but were definitely comfy and unique. (I felt a little like I was on a cruise ship.) Very modern and fun place, loved all the amenities and decor. Swam at the pool on the roof one day and had breakfast in the restaurant. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Alghamdi_f
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel but be aware the rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: smhart00
Reviews.Content: The pool and room were amazing and Nicole was an awesome server! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: MicNic78
Reviews.Content: We recently made a trip to the Dallas area to look at wedding dresses and decided to make a "girls" weekend out of it. We stayed at The Joule and had a fantastic time. I'd definetely recommend 3 things if you are staying at The Joule: 1) Eat at Charlie Palmer - This is the restaurant right in the hotel. The food and service is amazing! 2) Visit the Poule at the Joule - Make sure to ask for Todd or Stephen & make sure to swim to the edge and overlook the city. 3) Enjoy the ambiance - The rooms are so fun and decorative, our stay was wonderful! Again, we had such a fun time and it's really one of the better hotels to stay at . . .especially if you like a trendy feel, mixed with fabulous customer service. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: reddandkanedrea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AMAZING! The roof top pool area is so romatic and the bartenders keep your glasses full. Charlie Palmers is in this hotel, enough said. The detail in any of the rooms you stay in are just amazing. There is no other hotel in Dallas, Texas that comes close to comparison. (Not Four Seasons, Not Zaza, Not The Crescent) Get my point? Your room or suite will come with a fully stocked bar and snacks. They also provide two flutes for champagne. The suite does come with dimmers on all of the light switches..... The jacuzzi is very welcoming and comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “Stay every week - Service is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SPG1000Nights
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Joule 3 to 4 nights a week each week as I commute to Dallas. The staff is fantastic - Neil and Myron at the Front Desk always make me feel Welcome and Gus at the Valet provides a level of service rarely seen at any hotel. The decor is unique and the room layouts take a little getting used to, but I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. Additionally, if you want a quick bite while on the road - the bar at Charlie Palmer's offers a great menu for the solo diner.

Reviews.Title: “Steven and Todd at the pool deck bar make the hotel worth it”
Reviews.Author: Isactually
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smallish, don't stay in a round bed, but the pool deck and in particular Todd and Steven makes this our goto DFW hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and amazing...”
Reviews.Author: divlaw1111
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Joule was second to none and on par with the best hotels in the world. Craig that helped bring my one bags and all of my wife bags up was so helpful, especially with help explain the lights in the room, couldn't the hotel have less complicated lighting arrangements?. The pool is amazing and the restaurant cuisine is outstanding. If anything other hotels that are being built should use the joule as a starting point. When we checked out Danielle made it effortless and enticed us to come back again which we will and Travis that got our bags was warm and considerate to the delay we had in checking out. All in all... we will be back just the two of us for anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: priddygrrl
Reviews.Content: I submitted a previous review for the Joule where I stated that the pool was more for beautiful people than average Janes like me. The staff at the Joule contacted me, and we came back to stay again. This time, they went out of their way to ensure we had a great time at the pool. I have to say, staying at the Joule ranks as one of the best hotel experiences I've had anywhere! Everyone knows your name, service is top notch, and the surrounding area offers lots of attractions. Best place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with the most pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob60
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night so I did not get to use any of the hotel services nor dine there. However, the staff were all very nice and helpful. They also have complimentary car service via a Cadillac Escalade which takes you and picks you up anywhere within 5 miles of the hotel. Truly a wonderful, and from my experience unique service. Being it is very contemporary, be prepared for glass shower and toilet doors. Bed was very plush and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.....”
Reviews.Author: TWood32
Reviews.Content: Not only is this a great hotel, but I was traveling on business and experienced an illness during my trip. Not only did the hotel help me find a local doctor, but the manager on duty checked on me and sent chicken soup to the room to help me feel better. I wish i did not have to cut my trip short, because the pool looked like a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mbrunger0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Joule over the weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday and had a wonderful time! We especially enjoyed our time at the pool, and Todd made the weekend so much more fun! Thanks for a great weekend- hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: orangeskkye
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Dallas for a Birthday Party at the Joule and decided to stay out of convenience. It was priced a bit high but after our experience, we would definitely stay again! We arrived there and were greeted out front by a wonderful staff that helped to unload and park the car. Inside we were greeted again by the ambassador Shaye. She was amazing, she ensured that we were at ease with the accommodations...she even sent up complimentary milk and cookies for our four year old daughter. Later in the evening we went up to the Penthouse for the birthday party and were greeted by Virginia with the head of security, I could have talked to her all night! She was so friendly and attentive! When we checked out the next day, she even came out with us as we waited and we talked some more! Back to the Penthouse...what a view of Dallas, both at night with all the lights and then again in the morning when we met for breakfast. Two balconies offer two views. The staff in charge of the party was also great. They were there whether you needed a drink, desserts, or to clean up an area. All in all it was a great experience! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bob90024
Reviews.Content: The Joule exceeded my expectations. The hotel is contemporary yet luxurious and comfortable, it is hip but it doesn't feel like a nightclub with beds (like the W's tend to). All the staff members were very warm, friendly and helpful from the front desk to the phone operators, pool staff, etc. I stayed in a Grand Deluxe room (upgraded for SPG Gold which was very nice). This room has a great layout, a separate desk area in the hallway, a separate water closer, walk in shower with rain showerhead and a second adjustable showerhead, big sink area and a window. The bedroom, which is separated by a curtain has a big king size bed, 2 nightstands, a bench at the end of the bed, chair with ottoman, and large built-in furniture unit with drawers, the LCD TV and minibar. The room decor was contemporary but comfortable, the room was quiet and was bright and airy with the curtains open and dark with closed. The lights have a low, medium and high setting and can be controlled individually or with a master switch by the bed and entry. There are also several lamps and built in reading lights over the bed, all nice touches. There is a Bose wave radio with iPod dock. There is twice daily housekeeping which is another really nice touch. Plenty of towels in the room, etc. Room service breakfast has a limited menu but the food items are high quality. The coffee comes with a whole pot which is nice and the OJ is fresh. My only room service complaint is the ambiguous 19% "service charge", is this gratuity that goes to the waiter, does it go to the hotel? If you're going to auto-grat the bill should either be totaled and you just sign it or the bottom should should sub-total, grat, additional grat (that you can fill in or not) and total. I don't like feeling like I'm being tricked into double-tipping or being stingy, this should be fixed. The pool is a great amenity, it was great to hang out there Saturday afternoon, get a break from the concrete jungle. They were playing good music and had the misters going. There are several high quality Frontgate pool floats and the pool hanging over the edge of the hotel is pretty crazy. The pool service was great, the pool food menu is really good. My only gripe about the pool they have reconfigured it since the photos, there are now dining tables between the bar and the pool, promoting food service, and less lounge chairs for guests. They also reserve all or most of the good chairs for high-tab guests. They do let you use them before the reservation holders arrive so it isn't terrible, I'd like to see more first come first service chairs though, the pool is an amenity for the hotel guests. The hotel did reverse the old policy of allowing non-guests to pay to use the pool which helps a lot. The Charlie Palmer restaurant downstairs is one of the best in Dallas, it's well worth it! Parking is very expensive at $27 a day, the meters are enforced 7AM-6PM every day at $1.50 an hour (quarters only, come on Dallas this isn't 1995 get card meters) but there are lots of private lots that are no more than $5 a day and there are two city lots which is $2 a day on the weekend. It's up to you if you want the convenience of valet, or if you want to save $20 a day. I think the Joule is one of the best hotels in Dallas, especially for the price. I will be staying here again and I highly recommend it. The hotel is unique, the rooms are great, and the staff makes it special, being a Starwood property is icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice Hotel in a Dull Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a leisure weekend. Downtown area around it is sort of dead... the structure itself is a period building, renovated into a boutique hotel. Lobby is very nice, if a bit "tries to hard" and dark. Restaurant very nice for breakfast. Rooms also nice, well-maintained, if again trying a bit too hard - one almost feels like this hotel is screaming "yes, I know its Dallas, but Dallas can be trendy too!". I wasn't crazy about the way the bathroom is a bit open to the room. Very nice and helpful staff. Would certainly recommend any one stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: tulsatimeok
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers, we rate the Joule in downtown Dallas as one of the best! Staff is so nice and rooms perfect. Thanks Maverick for the super service at the 10th floor outdoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it more then EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: sadielh00
Reviews.Content: I stayed with you all in May of this year and I must say you have some of the best staff ever... When I was checking in Danielle had the most darling personality ever and was very swift. After that was all said and done Rudy assisted me with my bags and was very thoughtful of coversation the entire way up!!! I absolutely adored them both... Will def return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel, Fabulous service! This is my preferred Dallas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: denver24312
Reviews.Content: Not only was the hotel incredible with an amazing room, but the service and amenities are top notch. I needed a late night pressing of my suit. Done, with no hassle. Upon leaving the hotel I received a call that I left a very expensive watch in the room safe and it was returned with full communication. These folks go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “The Joule Dallas changed my life!”
Reviews.Author: Mloft
Reviews.Content: I came to The Joule with a friend for my 21st birthday and had an incredible stay. Besides the carpet being a damp when we arrived it was perfect! Service was wonderful and the grilled cheese is to die for in room service. You must lay by the gorgeous pool as well. Most definitely the best hotel in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend.. Good, Hotel Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ejaida
Reviews.Content: I am local to the area and on the recommendation of a co-worker, i stayed at the Joule instead of Zaza. From the minute I pulled into the hotel, it was nothing but first class service and a professional knowledgable staff. We ate at the restaurant before we were going to go out and the food was amazing and the service was second to none. I know that from Jennifer that checked us in with her welcoming smile we would have a good time. Craig is a knowledge person of the area and helped so much with all of our questions. I will be back again and recommend the switch to all my friends. Zaza is out and the Joule is the place to be

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: khotze
Reviews.Content: I stay at The Joule when in town on business and I've always loved it. Everyone in my company uses the hotel like a second home. The rooms are by far the coolest of any hotel I stay in nationally. Recently I left a personal item in the hotel room when I checked out (at 5am, so I was exhausted!) and when I got home I realized that it was gone. It would cost another $500 to replace this item, so I called the hotel wondering if by chance someone saved it. To my SHOCK, they had actually saved it and offered to ship it to me! Now THAT is service! As always, I will continue to stay at The Joule. Just had to share my experience. Many thanks to Jessica Doyle (Head of Housekeeping) for her help!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to go for a "Staycation"”
Reviews.Author: dougk2005
Reviews.Content: Very high end hotel that lived up to the hype. No free Wi-Fi or coffee in the room, but everything else was very nice. From the moment we pulled up and until we left we felt very welcomed and enjoyed all the hotel has to offer. The roof top pool was like a spa and even though it was 102 degrees, it felt very comfortable because of the fans and the misting system. If you want a private cabana by the pool, be sure to reserve it in advance. We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant Charlie Palmers and it was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel as a great place to get away and enjoy downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay...Definitely Will Return”
Reviews.Author: ShaleiCobb38
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Joule in Dallas. I usually stay at the "W' in Victory Park, but this Hotel was by far outstanding! The valet was wonderful, very helpful and polite. The staff was magnificent, very helpfull and informative. The rooms were fantastic, very clean, and had awesome showers!!! The pool was amazing as well, met a lot of nice couples on my stay, everyone was very laid back and had a great time! I would also like to acknowledge a gentlemen named Trey Shultz, I believe was his name, he played a very instrumental part of my enjoyable stay. He went above and beyond, and I appreciate everything he did. Overall was very pleased, and would definitely refer friends and family to your hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: clarkesbar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Joule this past week and will be back. The roof-top pool is very nice. The staff was great. The hotel has a "W" feel to it, but is more elegent. The art work in the hotel is also amazing. I took advantage of the comlimentary local transportation in the hotel's Escalade too!

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Hotel in Dallas - NO Doubt!!!”
Reviews.Author: Westondrive
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum starwood member and typically stay at the W Hotel or Westin properties. However, they were sold out and I always noticed the Joule Dallas hotel in the search results on SPB.com. So, the rate was great and the stay was absolutely Excellent!!!
