Everything from room service from the top Charlie Palmer restaurant in the hotel 24/7, plus the stunning gorgeous pool, amazing rooms, etc, etc. I can go on and on but if you have any options going to Dallas then the choice is easy. The Joule Dallas. Afterwards you can write your own review on this intimate and polished hotel. It is one of a kind and nothing else can compare in Dallas or wherever you may be....

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf. Leave the kids at home.”
Reviews.Author: Dble-D
Reviews.Content: VERY, VERY nice property. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Location wasn't the best and looked a little scary out on the street at times, but no issues while out walking before dark. The pool (or Poule as they call it) is as nice as any you will find, glass on the end which extends out at 10 stories high. As an order of french toast was around $20 I decided to walk down the street (out the front, down one block to left, take a left and Seven Eleven was on the right) and get a donut and some milk. The fitness center again was as nice as I've ever seen. I would not suggest bringing kids here although there were no problems we were the only family we saw. The adults at the pool were making out to the point a few of the couples should have went back to their rooms, needless to say we didn't stay at the pool long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great service. Great concierge and restaurant in lobby. LOTS of eye candy too.”
Reviews.Author: YHD
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to visit. The staff for the most part are excellent and helpful. For the most part the staff doesnt have all the attitude that the W staff does. Some of the younger front desk staff tend to be a little snooty. but for the most part, the staff is excellent. The concierge is very helpful and knows his stuff. The manager of the attached restaurantis also really helpful and provides excellent service - even though the restaurant is independently managed. The rooms are awesome except for the lack of privacy in the toilets that others have mentioned. The view from the lower floors is kinda cruddy and the street noise might get loud on the weekend. Overall, can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned! The hotel pool is open to the public on the weekends!”
Reviews.Author: sweatherley
Reviews.Content: We were staying only one night and were most looking forward to lounging leisurely next to the beautiful pool on Sunday afternoon. When the elevator opened on the floor of the pool, we could already hear and feel the bass from the LOUD music and crowd. The pool was completely packed with drunk, tattooed twenty-somethings like spring break in Daytona. None of these partiers were paying hotel guests, but they were definitely treated better than any of the guests we saw there. We immediately left. Later that night we returned to the hotel patio and wanted a simple meal. Since the squid and quail eggs on their menu did not sound good, one of our group walked across the street to order some Food and bring it over. We were barked at by the manager twice for bringing in outside food eve though we were buying their pricey drinks and paying for rooms there. They finally were ok with the outside food once they realized we were NOT moving it and were still quite unhappy about the pool situation. On a side note, the executive chef of the restaurant did come out to see us and was the only pleasant person we spoke to. While we will still never return to this hotel, the chef did make that evening a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - polite - personnel”
Reviews.Author: Marshall1125
Reviews.Content: Wow! Jennifer at the front desk was amazing. Extremely helpful, assisted in my every request and handled all of my accomodations for the weekend. Thank you Jennifer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Personnel!”
Reviews.Author: Venus21328
Reviews.Content: I live in the north DFW area, and it is my job to become very famiilar with many hotels and their services around the Metro-plex. The Joule was a refreshing experience and definitely a cut above the rest. Once I arrived, Danielle took great care to check me in and point me in the direction of my room, which I didn't leave much unless it was to have a meeting downstairs in the restaurant. Also, I must admit I took the liberty of telling alot of my friends about the beautiful pool that I had an hour to indulge in! It's not often I can say that I was treated like a celebrity. Craig respected my need for adhearance to a timely schedule during my check out and made it a seamless transaction. The decor, overall atmosphere, and excellent service in this hotel exceeds expectation. I would recommend this hotel to my existing and future out of town business clients when they visit, and I plan to make this my home away from home while conducting such visits. Thank you for renewing my faith in the hotel industry!

Reviews.Title: “I have never been treated so well!”
Reviews.Author: estarel1560
Reviews.Content: Hi my name is Ms. Sonasielle, Myself and my girlfriends were recently in Dallas, for a time of fun and quality together. We wanted to shop and have some fun at the pm lounge. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Joule. Our amazing time was made possible by two wonderful people, Craig and Rudy. All of our needs were met and they were on top of everything and made our experience at your hotel so worth it!!! If ever to return, I hope your hotel would be able to provide me with such outstanding employees such as, Rudy and Craig. Truly great guys! Chivalry is not dead!! sincerely, Ms. Sonasielle

Reviews.Title: “Craig made my stay at the Joule a great one!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruUu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Joule with some colleagues of mine. We were in town for the week and it was our first trip to Dallas. Craig was very knowledgable and helpful with everything, from finding a suitable conference room for our meetings to finding the perfect meal in town! I will be staying at the Joule again thanks to Craig and his outstanding customer service and ample knowledge of Dallas and the metroplex.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Dallas at The Joule, memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Starwood2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sunday through Friday and attended the convention center during the week. We used the complimentary shuttle daily. Rudy was so fine. Thursday afternoon swimming at sunset with the sounds of Patrick playing his guitar was a dream come true...because the 10th floor pool overhangs the hotel by several feet and I felt like I was swimming in heaven. The food at the Charles Palmer was delicious. They serve Lavazza Italian Coffee, the best I'd ever tasted. The services was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and chic”
Reviews.Author: Amarosen
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay and had a blast at joule poule the food at Charlie palmers was excellent as well

Reviews.Title: “A must place to stay when is Dallas”
Reviews.Author: maxat63
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, The staff was so helpful and nice. Beautiful rooms with a great views of Dallas. Highly recommend the Joule you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: txjlh
Reviews.Content: This is the Perfect Hotel!!! The Incredible Customer Service starts when you arrive at the door. The room was just beautiful. Beds so comfortable that you don't want to leave. The best location in downtown Dallas. Lot's of extras that make this hotel THE HOTEL! The pool area after the sun goes down is amazing. The Staff went above and beyond. Darrell went out of his way to make our visit extra special! I get the feeling that this is just the way it's done at the Joule for every guest. I look forward to my next stay at the Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff. Beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: thisisthedesk
Reviews.Content: Every person on staff was very professional and clearly dedicated to ensuring our stay was enjoyable. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I miss a few things...”
Reviews.Author: RaeSam3
Reviews.Content: I can't wake up without coffee, however there is no in room coffee; had to go to lobby for coffee or order room service for an instant fix. Second, no clock! I wake up all hours and I would to know the time without looking for my watch. In addition, I have a small child who is used to travel and nice hotels, but I would not come here with family. This is a very nice business hotel or a nice couple getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill”
Reviews.Author: MM8_21
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the hotel, loved the rooms, even though our room was a bit small they utilized the space very well. I had two problems with this place, first when I arrived home the day of our last stay I reviewed the invoice which had been emailed to me and was charged $202.00 for a dinner at Charlie Palmers, but we never dined at Charlie Palmers. I immediately called the hotel and reported the error. The next morning I received a call from the accounting department and received the proper credit. I also had a $45.00 charge or room service for a breakfast we ordered that was suppose to be included in the package when we made our reservations. The accounting department once again checked into this and called me right back and was able to credit me for this charge as well. So overall I would recommend the hotel but just double check EVERYTHING on your invoice. It was really disappointing to have not just one error but two errors on my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience I've Had”
Reviews.Author: ashleyet18
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience staying at the Joule. I took my boyfriend their for a staycation for his birthday. They upgraded us to a suite free of charge, brought in cupcakes, a special beer and were of ongoing assistance through out the stay, helping to make his birthday a great day and full of surprises. I truly appreciated how thorough they were in handling my requests and following up with me to ensure that I knew everything was taken care of. In addition to all of their extra assistance and care, the facilities are phenomenal. The pool is great, it has great night life, and the rooms and beds are great! That bed is the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever stayed in. This hotel receives my strongest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Complete Delight”
Reviews.Author: MaRoq
Reviews.Content: On 3/27/11, we checked into The Joule in Dallas, TX. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, valet and front desk staff greeted us attentively. Even as we exited the elevator to our floor, a housekeeping staff member assisted immediately in locating our room. The convenient location of The Joule allowed us to choose from a variety of restaurants. The comfort level of our room also allowed us to rest peacefully without any interrupting noise, enjoy a good nightâ€™s sleep, and relax while watching TV. Overall, our stay at The Joule was a complete delight. Immediately I contacted family and friends to share my experience and offer my recommendation to stay at The Joule. We look forward in experiencing The Joule again in the near future as we continue to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A property that made me feel special! Genuine service!”
Reviews.Author: tiki2011
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay ay the Joule for my birthday! Best decision I've made in a long time, considering I celebrate the whole month. Valet greeted me and asked what my name was, he then passed me on to the bellman he then explained the hotel. When I went to the front desk they all wished me a happy birthday and thanked me for staying there. Everyone from Todd at the pool to Enam and the staff at Charlie Palmer. This was truly an amazing birthday! Something like a palooza of fun! I can't wait to stay here in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pick with Superior Decor and Service”
Reviews.Author: KevinandPaul
Reviews.Content: Trendy, gorgeos and unique! The staff were very attentive, the rooms perfect and there is a heated pool that hangs over the edge of the building from the 10th floor. We loved the view from our corner room which looked out on Main Street and could see the pool below. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel truly has it all..with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: RomiDallas
Reviews.Content: I've had to stay at The Joule on business for almost 2 weeks and found that it had everything I needed for a lengthy period away from home. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of there way to be accommodating. The complementary car service was a real bonus (within a 5 mile radius) and Rudy my driver, was an absolute pleasure. Virginia on the front desk was also delightful, nothing was ever a chore. I used the fitness centre and free wi-fi daily. The rooms themselves are modern, spacious and comfortable. The in-dining menu and service was also delicious, however I managed to try charlie palmers downstairs a few times which was also excellent. Whilst I was here for work, I would stay here on vacation quite happily.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staycation!”
Reviews.Author: bcbosu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Joule just to get away for one night. We had a great time! The hotel is very unique, very very nice. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the food at Charlie Palmer was to die for!

Reviews.Title: “The Joule is the perfect weekend getaway in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: kholmes461
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th Anniversary this part weekend at the The Joule. The Joule is elegantly eclectic. We both needed to destress after a long week. The staff made us feel welcome and relaxed from the minute we pulled up to the valet stand. PM was icing on the cake. Thank you Joule!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Partnership”
Reviews.Author: Storm2Deep
Reviews.Content: I'm a CTM for an Architecture firm with a lot of Classy Visionarions. Design, structure and concept is what they live and breath so when picking a hotel for them to stay at be it landmark, new, contemporary it needs to of class. From the accomdating and courteous staff, the top notch service, attention to detail, luxurious design and elegent accents The Joule measures up. Who doesn't love a rooftop pool for a nightcap. Knowing that PSP team and clients are in good hands, I sleep at night. Thanks you Joule staff for doing what you do with elegant touch.

Reviews.Title: “Completely above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: EmilyE5622
Reviews.Content: We had rented a loft suite to throw my friend a bachelorette shower and have invited a total of 17 girls. There were 11 of us staying at the hotel. A few days before they had to cancel our suite. I was extremely upset and frustrated. However, they went above and beyond to take care of us. They threw us a catered private party, on the roof, under a heated tent. They catered to our every whim, and were so friendly and courteous. They even stocked our bus for us while we were at the party so we could suprise our guests! I would completely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “From the turn-down service to the personal attention given by Henry and the valet staff, The Joule is our new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: TxAg87
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were wonderful, the canti-levered pool was gorgeous and the lobby ultra chiq...but the best attribute by far was the care and attention to detail given by Henry and the valet staff! Always curteous and extremely helpful, they went above and beyond in getting us where we nneded to go and on time!! Thank you for a fabulous weekend and hats off to Henry and the entire valet staff and their "bloody good" service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aholmberg
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 18 for me and my coworkers here for a series of business meetings in Dallas. The hotel was beautiful; the staff was very accommodating; and it was very easy working with a large group. The only downside was that I was there in January, and the Poule was not open. I definitely will try to get back when it is warmer!

Reviews.Title: “if you need to stay downtown....this is the place”
Reviews.Author: Nycmarky
Reviews.Content: I love the Joule. It makes me feel like I'm at home. The rooms are luxury, the finishes like a loft apartment. The bed is super comfortable - high quality cotton sheets, great shower....It has style.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Perfection”
Reviews.Author: michaeldwayne
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is PERFECTION! My wife and I live locally but had the opportunity to have a â€œstaycationâ€� for one night. The staff was exceptional and the product is one of a kind! From the smiles on the valet drive to the welcoming front office staffâ€¦we felt at home right away. The detail in the rooms are amazing and the artwork throughout the property is incredible...this hotel is like no other! We ate at Charlie Palmer Restaurant for dinner. The dry aged sirloin is to die for! The wine sommelier was beyond knowledgeable when it came to finding the perfect bottle of wine to accommodate both our meals. We slept in what I would consider one of the most comfortable beds I have ever experienced. I LOVE this hotel! This was the perfect stay and truly a "jewel" in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Excellent Experience for our Guests!”
Reviews.Author: lstolz
Reviews.Content: We have set up many group stays with The Joule and have always been very satisfied! Our contact, Jessica Craycraft, is very professional and is always eager to assist with our requests. Our guests are typically on the younger side, but everyone at the hotel has always treated them with the utmost of respect. The warm, modern feel of the hotel is a big hit with our guests! They also love the pool area that overlooks Main street! I would defintely recommend The Joule for group stays!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed. Would come back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: lesliebee
Reviews.Content: Working with this hotel has been a breeze. Jessica and Byron were able to help organize my large group of 21 guests with ease. Every detail was managed perfectly. I am very happy with my stay. Thank you so much! Also, the hotel offers complimentary shoe shining service. -- LB

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Service, but don't valet with them and check your bill”
Reviews.Author: jramire2
Reviews.Content: First the good things about the hotel. The front desk service was excellent, I'm an SPG gold member and was upgraded from a demi joule room to a deluxe. A deluxe is pretty much the standard room at this hotel, nothing special in regards to size, but bigger than the demi. The dual head shower is great, but not tub like the joule suites. I went down to the front desk later asking if a suite was available for me to pay to upgrade to, but they were all taken. The front desk manager was sorry about this and we later found a handwritten note from her with a voucher for in room breakfast for my wife and I, a very nice plus for us because we were staying there for valentines day. The concierge was also able to get us dinner reservations at a very small but very popular sushi restaurant in the area, this was a big plus because I knew this restaurant wouldn't take reservations from me when I called them directly (parties of 6 or more only) and there was already a long wait when we arrived. Now the bad; This hotel is located downtown, so unless you want to park on the street overnight and wake up at 7am to feed quarters into the meters (tickets are given 7 days a week) you have to find a self pay/self park lot nearby or valet with the hotel. There weren't many parking lots I could see within reasonable walking distance, so I chose to valet with the hotel. BIG MISTAKE. The next morning when the valet pulled up our car I noteced he had rolled down the drivers side window all the way, which was strange because it was kind of chilly. When I got into my car I realized why, whoever parked the car for us the night before, sat in our car and smoked a cigarette, didn't even try to hide it as he just left the butt in the ashtray and ashes on the console. This is NOT cool, first of all we don't smoke so this was very obvious and second my wife has asthma and my 2 year old rides in my car all the time. AND to top it off, the guy also rifled through my glovebox, found a half box of chocolates from a movie dat we had the other night, ate them and then left the empty box on the floor. WTF? The chocolates were just regular old chocolates, but the fact that he went through our stuff, utterly and completely unprofessional. Needless to say I immediately went back in and let the front desk know what happened and so far everything looks like it's going to be taken care of by the hotel and the valet company. He comped us for the parking and put me in touch with the valet manager (evidently this hotel outsurces to an independent valet company). I've coordinated with the valet manager and my dealership to get the car in for a full detail and odor removal process, the valet company will be paying for all of it. I haven't gotten the car cleaned yet, but hopefully they hold up their end and actually pay for it. So while the hotel is great, I really would advise against valeting with them, which makes staying at this hotel pretty difficult since there's no nearby parking lots. And to top it all off, I checked my credit card statement today and found that they charged me for some minibar items that we supposedly took. This is complete c*&p because we declined a minibar key when we checked into the hotel and we definitely didn't take anything from it. I've called them and they're going to refund the charges, but it's supposed to take 7-10 business days. All in all, the hotel is great, the service we received directly from the hotel was definitely great, but the lack of trustworthy parking in the area and all the dramal with the valet and my bill really killed the experience. I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you're not going to have a car and you watch your credit card statements closely.

Reviews.Title: “the experience of a life time !”
Reviews.Author: nmart455
Reviews.Content: The Staff Was amazing and a special staff member name shrecka clark was so helpfull they made or stay super special, an i thought it was just us but as i was walking out an saw people checking in the hotel everyone was welcome the same way, as royalty ! an all the staff welcome you an said hello , an how are you doing , wow ! great Experience!

Reviews.Title: “well taken care of”
Reviews.Author: jefcars
Reviews.Content: The staff here is great. I was there for 3 nights. it is always great when the doormen remember your name. I left a personal item behind when i checked out, and they called me that night and shipped it the next day. Wish the weather had been nice enough to use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: JPS2024
Reviews.Content: I had a 3-day business meeting at The Joule with 10 collegues flying in from throughout the country. I was a little concerned heading into the meeting as we planned to have breakfast and lunch served in the same meeting room the entire time. However, the food was excellent, varied and no one complained. The staff was very attententive and very accomodating to every request. The hotel was clean, comfortable, chic and everyone enjoyed the stay although a few of us did comment on the guest room bathrooms being a little on the dark side. It was the coldest weather in 18 years in Dallas during our stay, however, we walked to nearby restaurants for dinner each evening with plenty of dining options. I highly recommend The Joule for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “One of Kind and truly the best in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: lennyofmice
Reviews.Content: I work in Dallas in the world film production and have jobs that come into town with casts and crews in the upwards of 20 to 30 people and The Joule is always my first choice. In the world of film production we are difficult to work with. We are demanding, cheap, and we change everything all the time at the last moment. The Joule's staff handles our woe's like pros. Their customer service is superb and the people are wonderful to work. No matter what we throw at them they are more than happy always help us however they can. These people are just AMAZING. As for the Hotel, well it is a site to be seen. Beautiful, Modern, Clean, Cool, and oh my god the food.. you have to dine at the Charley Palmer. I actually enjoy just wondering around the hotel from time to time checking out all the neat decor. The pool at the Joule is a must see as it actually hangs over the streets of Dallas. The rooms are all great but I must say... If you ever get the chance at least check out the loft suites. They one I stayed in a few times is absolutely one of the most amazing hotel rooms I have ever stayed in hands down. Its worth it for the incredible bathtub alone. My only complaint about the rooms are that the beds are so comfortable that it does make getting up in the morning, if you have to go to work, so hard. Great mattresses. The location is perfect as well for its actually right in the middle of downtown and their are so many cool things to do right there within walking distance. Having worked in Dallas for so long, I have either worked with, work from, or stayed in most of the Major hotels in Dallas and Fort Worth. The Joule is hands down my favorite. Zaza, The W, Palomar, The Omni, The Fairmont, The Magnolia, The Ritz... Non of these come close. I will say I do still love The Belmont Hotel in South Dallas. Very cool retro Hotel and awesome staff, but its biggest drawback is location. In a few years when they have built up more around it so that the neighborhood isn't as scary it will be a force to be reckoned with, but for now The Joule is hands down the King of Dallas Luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Seldom41
Reviews.Content: i had a business conference in Dallas and was fortunate enough to get a discounted rate at the Joule for myself and a few colleagues. our contact at the hotel, Jessica Craycraft, went above and beyond to provide us with quality service and was always available whenever we needed something. The staff was friendly yet very professional. the overall service provided was great value for money. the stay was a breeze. would love to go back i a heartbeat. the hotel has an excellent in house restaurant with plenty on the menu and delectable choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a business meeting!”
Reviews.Author: rgajda
Reviews.Content: I plan several business meetings throughout the US every year, and this hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. The hotel has an extreme modern decor, both in the lobby and the guest rooms. The beds were comfortable and the rooms and meeting spaces were clean. There was a new TV and i-pod docking station in the room, and the bathroom was spectacular. Their workout facility had brand new equipment, and the pool (although it was not "swimming" weather for Dallas) was gorgeous. The service was outstanding. Because I planned an event at the hotel, I was automatically upgraded to a suite. In the suite is a jacuzzi bath tub, which I of course had to take advantage of during my stay. The hotel had run out of bubble bath, so instead of simply saying, "Too bad", the concierge walked down the street to the Neiman Marcus and purchasing bubble bath for me. They even asked what kind of scent I would prefer. I didn't realize this kind of service even existed anymore! The location was perfect. It was right on Main Street where a lot of the restaurants and night life is located. After traveling 50% of the time for my job, this is hands down one of the top three nicest hotels that I have ever stayed at, especially for the price! I would recommend it to anyone who is traveling to Dallas for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and tastefully well appointed; great service”
Reviews.Author: maxwellmark
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for the weekend. We had plans to go to some other places, but after a great dining experience at Charlie Palmer's, we went downstairs to the Lounge. We really had fun there. We never left The Joule that evening. I would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dog-Friendly and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: jasonfking
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Joule, and the first time with our 70 lb. puppy. In short, this is quite possibly my favorite place to stay in the world. The wine list is top-notch, the bathtub (in the Joule Suite) is ridiculously luxurious, the products are great, the dark wood in the bathrooms... I could go on and on. The doormen greeted us and Meaux-Meaux (our dog) with a treat every time we returned from a walk (there is a dog park a block away). If I have to invent a complaint, it is that the belt loop on my robe was torn. Seriously, that is my only complaint. I assume they would have sent me a new robe had I asked, but it didn't really bother me all that much. I have never stayed here in the summer, so I can't really comment on the pool area, but the cantilevered pool is beautiful. I really love this place. I'll stay here every time I come to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, extraordinary accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: JamieFish
Reviews.Content: I ended a five week business trip at this hotel and it was by far the best experience that I had. The staff is truly extraordinary and made me feel at home. The room product is gorgeous and the beds are extremely comfortable. The location in the heart of Dallas offers easy access to everything that the city has to offer. I am a self-proclaimed (and other people proclaim it too) hotel snob and I couldn't have been happier! This is my number 1 choice of hotel in Dallas, Texas.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: PCsGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible! The architecture and furnishings are amazing - very modern and chic. The rooms are reminiscent of a very high end loft with snazzy Italian furniture. I spend many nights per year in hotels and this is the first one where I actually "explored" my room. Every detail from the iPod docking station to the little reading lights built into the headboard are designed to accomodate the modern traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Jennifer Vincent and the staff rolled out the red carpet and made us feel special!”
Reviews.Author: carabasnett
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time celebrating our daughter's 13TH birthday at the Joule in Dallas....from the time we were greeted until the time we checked out, we were made to feel special and welcomed. Our tweens loved the salt water heated infinity pool, the Charlie Palmer bar, awesome room service and gorgeous room......we live in Carrollton, but felt we had traveled to another luxurious country! Thank you so much JENNIFER AND STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Scaceres
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at this hotel for his Birthday. It was so romantic, fun and special that he later told me, it was the best birthday he ever had. We travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels thrughout the nation. None of the hotels can be compared to The Joule in Dallas. They treated us like a King and a Queen to say the least. The hospitality, the staff, the restaurant, the nightclub, I am speechless. I would also like to compliment all of the employees at The Joule especially Myron at the front desk. He was outstanding, superb, a true example of excellence to say the least. I truly recommend The Joule especially if you want to spend some quality time with your significant other, a romantic getaway or if you want to celebrate a special moment with your other half. Trust me, You will never forget this place and you will fall in love with your partner over and over again! Silvia & Luis Capote

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTravelhappy
Reviews.Content: The Joule Dallas is a hoteliers dream. All of the details from the lobby theme and decor to the functional and modern bathrooms have been impeccably taken care of. The beds are luxurious and will envelop you in dream inducing comfort. The clean lines and technically savvy components of the guest rooms ensure that you remain at ease and connected while you travel. The staff is professional and accommodating of all needs. Great hotel that should not be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: choth21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently. I am a Hyatt Diamond but only a SPG Gold member. I knew I wasn't going to get the same benefits at this hotel as the benefits I get when visiting Hyatt, but I was still a little disappointed with this hotel. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. Check-in was fine. I was told I was "upgraded" to a Deluxe King room. I'm not sure how this was an upgrade since the only category of room lower is the Demi-Joule room, and I also originally booked a Deluxe King, but I didn't press it. I found the room to have a nice design, although having the desk in an alcove instead of in the same room as the TV was not ideal. Also, I am not a fan of pillow top mattresses. I find them too soft and that was the case here. But that's not a criticism of this hotel, since I find that at many hotels. I did like the iPod docking station and I liked the Remede toiletries. The shower was nice too. And while the sink looked nice, it is entirely impractical since the bowl shape of it made water splash all over the counter and your clothes if you weren't careful about turning on the water not too high. I like hotels with shuttle services around town and the shuttle service here is in an Escalade. However, I found that the front desk had a severe inability to give an accurate timeline as to when it was available. This culminated in me waiting 40 min for the shuttle to come pick me up when I was told 10-15 min. I could have taken a cab, but I was in an area where I would have had to call for one, and I thought that would take too long. In retrospect, maybe that's what I should have done. I also found the service to be a little amateurish. I know they were a little short-staffed due to the holiday, but the hotel was also less than 50% full (from what I was told.) The shuttle service was my biggest issue. But I also frequently had to call services multiple times because no one picked up the phone the first time. The restaurant also closed 1/2 an hour early one night, which made me upset (probably because it was the same night I had to wait 40 min for the house car to pick me up.) I voiced my complaints and was given free breakfast, which was nice. At any rate, I probably won't be back here. Service issues aside, I didn't like the rooms, because I found them a bit cramped. I come to Dallas often for work, and will pick somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and clever thinking!”
Reviews.Author: dsogrady
Reviews.Content: Modern and comfortable guestrooms. Loved that the desk was behind the headboard - clever use of space! My bell man walked me through the different settings & gagets in the room, that was really useful. Loved the low, medium & high settings on the lighting, this is great if you're not a morning person like myself!! The food was amzing, the room service food is from the restaurant downstairs!! Loved it all, the bread options, the mushroom plate - yummy! Loved the rose prosecco too :-) the decor was really fun and innovative throughout, like the large moving cogs by the check-in desk or the chairs in the lobby with sliding silver tables attached, or the secret reading lamp on the guestrooms headboards. My only regret is that i wasn't here on a weekend to experience the nightclub downstairs or in the summer to hangout by the roof top pool all day and drink cocktails!! All in all, the one thing that stood out the most throughout my stay was by far the service. From the bell staff, to the bar staff, everyone was friendly, welcoming and eager to help all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday trip!”
Reviews.Author: mcunningham34
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the The Joule on a trip to Dallas for my 40th birthday. We wanted to be downtown near the Arts District and The Joule looked great online. We were so happy with our choice. Katy, the concierge, was very helpful in making reservations and recommendations. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We never used room service but we ate dinner at Charlie Palmers once and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms in this downtown luxury hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: mke-atty
Reviews.Content: There are probably more remote controls in these rooms than in any other hotel you have stayed in. The first time I stayed here, I arrived late and figuring out all the controls was maddening. But I have stayed here three times since and like the hotel. The staff is great and the hotel has a great Charlie Trotter restaurant. (But what's with the big wooden wheel in the lobby?)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: PCHamby
Reviews.Content: We went to the Joule as a treat for our anniversary. The hotel is gorgeous and our room was clean, modern, and just as I expected a Luxury Starwood Hotel should be. The staff was friendly from the time I made arrangements over the phone w/ the concierge (prior to our arrival) through the time we left the hotel. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars (if I could it would be 4.75) on "Service" is b/c they weren't so timely on pre-arranged room service...we asked for it by a certain time and it arrived about a half hour later. None-the-less, it was still delicious! You must try their signature desserts, the peanut butter bar...YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cool night scene”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a better location than the W, unless you're going to a Mavericks' game. I had a business dinner and when I arrived back at the hotel, there was 100 people in the lobby at a cocktail hour. Bottom line is that there is a cool scene at night (I was there on a Wednesday), and the pool is awesome. Also, there are a bunch of restaurants within short walking distance of the hotel. In general, this hotel is WAAAAY better than the other starwood properties in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommyirons
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we were completely blown away, from the amazing scent in the lobby to the comped glass of Champagne while we were checking in. The rooms were hip, super modern and spacious. We also had dinner on sight at Charlie Palmers downstairs. WOW, best meal and service in the city. I would recommed this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “After 5 years of living in hotels, hands down the best”
Reviews.Author: joshsmith17
Reviews.Content: I have been consulting for 5 years which means I typically live at a hotel Monday through Thursday every week. The Joule staff is the most helpful, nice, and proactive hotel staff I have come across. I can't begin to explain how great they were over the past 10 months. If you are going to stay in Dallas, especially for business, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: smj22
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after spending three nights at The Joule. We enjoyed our stay! The beds were comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were pleasant and quiet even though it was crowded for the UT/OU game. My kids especially liked the drapes the separated the bedroom from the bathroom area. We especially found the room service to be timely and tasty (yes, we even had breakfast by the pool one day!). We also ate great food in the restaurant. The chef generously shared the granola recipe with my husband, who declared it the best granola he'd even eaten. The pool was too chilly for the kids to spend much time in it, but that isn't surprising for this time of year. There was a mix-up with an upgrade for our room, but that was the only disappointment with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality at The Joule”
Reviews.Author: NobleDoc
Reviews.Content: From the moment of check-in to check-out, our experience was first class. Want a wine glass? Promptly there. Need a ride to the State Fair? No problem. A Swedish massage and organic egg breakfast were included and were most memorable. Service was always with a smile and was always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at The Joule began early...”
Reviews.Author: 1erudite
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Joule began early afternoon on September 3rd. I selected this location to celebrate my retirement following 25 years service with the United States Courts. The reception was held in the beautiful Radiiant Salon room and catered by Charlie Palmer's, the hotel's famous restaurant. From it's convenient location to the Dallas business hub for guests, to the captivating style of the hotel, to the impeccable service, this was the perfect place for my event. My guests were so intrigued by the history and architecture. We reserved a guest room which was beautiful and enjoyed a wonderful breakfast on the patio Saturday morning at Charlie Palmer's Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: T1158
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits in the heart of Dallas. It is close to AA arena so you can catch a lot of great events. The staff was friendly and informative. I loved Charlie Palmer's. Great food. Fun pool atmosphere! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: KLogan_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Joule on Saturday night and had the most fantastic experience!! The location is in the middle of downtown and walking distance to a couple of cute bars / restaurants. This place is beauiful!! No detail is missed. We were greeted with a complimentary glass of champagne and unmatched service during the check in process. The room was awesome - modern, sleek and amazing. We were given complientary car service to our evening event and ordered a delicious breakfast in bed (which arrived ...right on time). I can't say enough good things about this hotel and their staff. We will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Luxury, People!”
Reviews.Author: Lilusmom
Reviews.Content: The Joule is touted as a luxury property. I would say for us, it was beyond luxury! I've stayed in numerous properties of this caliber over the last 25 years on business so I know what I'm talking about. On this occasion however, I went for pleasure. We were greeted at the curb by 3 very friendly bell staff. In less than 30 seconds we were unloaded, vehicle whisked away for parking. We walked to the front desk and were promptly greeted by name, wished a happy anniversary complete with a champagne toast and our room keys. Dinner at Charlie Palmer's was terrific and it finished with an anniversary card of sorts with a message spelled in chocolate at the top of our unbelievably rich Peanut Butter Bar - which btw, was practically a religious experience! The concierge drove us herself to the symphony when it was apparent that there was a traffic snafu that could render us late. Upon our return our suite was adorned with rose petals, chilled champagne and a basket of fruit. Loved. the. shower. All of the staff appeared to really like their jobs. It was more than your usual hotel staff friendliness, it was an attitude of liking what they did. The only down-side for us (because we're not as young as we used to be) was the night life (we were there on a Friday night) on the street kicks in at about midnight and continues with great enthusiasm until about 4am. Had we been paying attention though, we could have asked for a room on the back side of the hotel when we made our reservation. Would I recommend the Joule to others? Well the fact that 3 days later I was wishing I was there again should answer the question. YES! Great property in a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel de Luxe!!”
Reviews.Author: mflinden
Reviews.Content: I had the extreme pleasure of experiencing The Joule for one night in Dallas last week. My only regret is that I didn't have longer to bask in it fabulousness! Truly spectacular space. The building is old and classic and unassuming, and once you have walked through the lobby doors, you know you have arrived someplace special. It is thoughtful and sophisticated and high-design without overpowering as some do. The restaurant attached to the lobby was beautifully appointed and the service for the drink we had there was exceptionally good. We had reservations elsewhere, but I noticed that I didn't want to leave the space as it was so warm and inviting. The Joule Suite was arguably one of the nicest room I have ever experienced. Sophisticated and elegant, high-design but extremely comfortable at the same time, with every detail well thought out. Our bell man offered us a tour of the space, something I have never seen before, and he proceeded to point out the many features that made the room a cut above that we would have missed otherwise. That was a very nice touch! The bathroom was beautiful and the bed was amazing, if only I could sleep that well at home! The pool experience however was really the cherry on top, a virtual oasis high above and amongst the city scape, very impressive indeed. I will stay at the Joule whenever I get through Dallas again, and in fact would love to go back just to experience more of it. I highly recommend this experience to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: stthomas333
Reviews.Content: We had hoped for a special hotel and got this instead. Location poor and forget to mention to us that our parking would be extra. Night staff not particularly friendly or helpful. Rooms would be fine for a 3 star. All in all not even close to it's 4+ star rating.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Mark-TulsaOklahoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were able to go on a trip to celebrate our anniversary. We wanted something that was unique and my wife found The Joule. We were looking for something that combined elegance, art, and architecture. We found that to be true. I cant say enough about The Joule. I have read some of the reviews that spoke of bad service. I cant say enough about the service. They were excellent. They seemed eager to work and acted like they truly enjoyed their job. We went to the Rangers game and when we came back to the hotel, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne and two glasses for our anniversary. We were disappointed about the hours of the Charlie Palmer and the bar downstairs but found an outstanding place to get a drink directly across the street. In closing, we will be back. I look forward to going back to Dallas just to stay at The Joule

Reviews.Title: “A cut above!”
Reviews.Author: tommycabosgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel combines the best of both worlds. It has most of the ammenities of a fine hotel as well as a very unique rooftop pool and bar that makes you feel like you are on vacation at a resort! We only went for one night. A spur of the moment overnight trip to Dallas, but we had a fabulous time. Spent all afternoon at the pool after checking in. The only complaint we did have is by later afternoon the pool was extremely overcrowed. I found out talking to different ones that many people there were not registered hotel guests. This was not cool! Other than that we had a great time and will visit again. The beds and rooms were clean and well maintained also. Staff was all friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property; amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Legalhavok
Reviews.Content: The Joule is an amazing hotel. The rooms are beautiful, the pool is unique, the Charlie Palmer serves one of the best filets I've ever had, and the PM Lounge offers a classy, fun nightlife atmostphere. Nothing but good experiences at the Joule--highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: tjavi
Reviews.Content: This property is amazing and beautiful. The hotel staff is very hospitable and very happy. The rooms are gorgeous. When you walk into the room you have a moment of delightful surprise on how detailed and high end the finish out is in the rooms. The food from Charlie Palmer is delicious. We also went to PM to celebrate my husbands birthday and the service there was excellent and the dj was fabulous. I just wanted to dance all night. Then the next day we visited the pool area which was very unique, the pool over extends the building so when you are in the pool at the end of it you are on top of main st in the middle of downtown Dallas so the view was phenomenal. I have been to a lot of the hotel properties in Dallas and the Hotel Joule is my far the most luxurious, plush and trendy of them all.

Reviews.Title: “best service, luxury”
Reviews.Author: elle_stephens
Reviews.Content: From the second I pulled up, the friendly gentlemen at the door made me feel right at home! I spent about 30 minutes exploring the room which is artfully constructed and holds many surprises. The details and accommodation are amazing. I came back from a client dinner to see my room completely 'turned down' - it was gorgeous and such a nice touch. The gym is good and was not crowded on a Thursday night. I have not made it to the pool yet (it was closed for a private event during the day), but I have heard it is one of the best in Dallas. There is ample desk space. The only thing I would add: I wish the internet service was included.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: rks0003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary this weekend. We received prompt and courteous service at check-in, and arrived to find an extremely nice well appointed room. Their fitness facilities were nice with plenty of aerobic equipment and a enough weights to get in a nice workout. The rooftop pool was very relaxing. An Infinity pool hangs over Main Street providing for a unique panorama of downtown Dallas. The Joule staff suprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne upon our return from the pool. This was a great suprise and much appreciated. The hotel is in a nice location with good access to some great restaurants. We definitely look foward to returning to this downtown Dallas gem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel... TERRIBLE management!”
Reviews.Author: myfavorite8899
Reviews.Content: My very good friend booked a room at the Joule for her birthday last weekend and invited a few friends, myself included, to celebrate a safe and enjoyable evening. We began the evening in the hotel room, then walked a short distance to a nearby resturant for dinner. When we returned, we waited in line to enter the PM Lounge, a club on the bottom floor of the Joule. The doorman refused to allow us entry and we ended up waiting for almost an hour in the Texas heat while other folks would simply walk off the street and were immediately allowed in! My friend finally asked why we were waiting while everyone else was allowed in and the man very rudely announced that those folks were hotel guests. The birthday girl informed the man that she too was a hotel guest but he only said he would look into it. I was appalled that we were treated that way. The birthday girl waited for another 45 mins to speak to the hotel manager about the situation, but he was preoccupied trying to iron out a situation for some honeymooners who had made reservations that the hotel couldn't locate. (Apparently we weren't the only guests to have their evening botched by this hotel). After such a long and sweltering wait, the b-day girl's guests began to just leave out of frustration. The guest who remained were forced to go across the street to a dive bar where the b-day girl began to cry uncontrollably over her ruined special evening. It was insulting that the doorman/management were so disrespectful and unwilling to take care of their guest. I would never recommend this hotel or their club PM Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a couple of things to watch out for”
Reviews.Author: ValerieSmithTX
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at the Joule for a weekend away from the kids. Good location and very helpful staff. We were on the 10th floor which is where the Pool/Bar is located. Very noisy from this area until 2am. Would ask for room on another floor next time. Biggest issue was when we picked up our car from the valet parking. There was damage to the hood and front bumper which was not present when we left the car the previous night. We brought this to the attention of the valet manager who said "we were very busy last night and had 8 or 9 guys parking cars. I wish they would have told me when they did this". To his credit he was very helpful and filled out a claim report and gave us info about who to contact. I know this could happen anywhere but in years of valet parking it hasnt so this was quite annoying. They did refund our $27 valet parking fee. Hopefully they will step up and take care of this. We saw another guest who was checking out looking at the back of his vehicle as well!

Reviews.Title: “We just spent our last night at the Joule”
Reviews.Author: eatapper
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Joule in February 2009 for our 20th anniversary and had a wonderful stay. The hotel had opened recently, and the staff really went out of their way to ensure that we were happy and comfortable. Had I written this review then I would have given them five stars. We've stayed 3 times since then and every stay has gotten worse. It's a beautiful property that is very poorly managed, and the staff seems unable (and unwilling) to handle the hotel when it is crowded. The last time we stayed our room was never cleaned. We complained twice, and even left the room so housekeeping could come in and they still never came. Finally at 10:30 at night we spoke to the manager and sat in the lobby while they at least made the bed and gave us clean towels. Yesterday we tried to check in at 4:30 in the afternoon (check in is at 3:00) and were told that our room wasn't ready and had to wait an hour to get into our room, which forced us to cancel our dinner reservations. Once there, we found an ironing board, but no iron and when we asked to have one delivered we were told that they weren't sure when they would be able to locate one. The staff is indifferent at best, and they don't even pretend to try to solve your problem. Additionally, they have made their pool a "scene" for twenty-somethings who are not guests of the hotel, which means that guests get to ride in the elevator with drunk kids wearing nothing but wet swim suits, and there is never room for guests to enjoy the pool. Bottom line, I'm shocked that Starwood (we are very devoted members) allows this hotel to remain in their "Luxury Collection". While the property is lovely, we've received better service at hotels half the price of the Joule. If you want to stay downtown, you would do better at the Ritz Carlton or Hotel Zaza. If you are a loyal Starwood member, the W or even the Westin Galleria provides better service than the Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Dallas by far!!”
Reviews.Author: hoopdawg02
Reviews.Content: The Joule hotel is the best hotel in Dallas. It is on Main St in downtown Dallas and is located on a strip where there are nightclubs and late night pizza places. Alissa Mitchell helped us and she was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Well Beyond My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: bfreebcAspen
Reviews.Content: I thought I had seen it all until I stayed at the Joule. The service was absolutely first rate. The bellman had my luggage out of the trunk before I stepped out of the car and led me inside. It's rare to find a hotel with so much attention to detail and it's obvious that no expense was spared. The entire hotel is a work of art and when I got to my room I spent the first hour exploring it's uniqueness. I had dinner at the restaurant that night and it was amazing from the service, ambiance and quality of the food. They have a special lunch that includes a soup, salad and half sandwich that's quick and inexpensive. The Joule is a sexy, elegant, fun, cool and incredibly unique experience. I'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place but pool more for "beautiful people" than swimmers”
Reviews.Author: priddygrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Joule for my anniversary with my husband. The hotel room was pristine and beautiful, and the staff was extremely friendly and polite (not at all condescending which can sometimes occur in a high-end hotel like this). I agree with one reviewer that the outside club noise was a bit excessive, but that's the price for the great locale! My only real negative was that I'm an avid swimmer and the pool was closed for a private party from approx 6 pm until 10 the evening of our stay. The management opened the pool later (10-midnight) so we decided to try it then. Not only was no one swimming in the pool - but all of the "beautiful people" - I assume from the evening's party - were still hanging around in cocktail dresses and sportcoats. Needless to say, I felt very out of place in my suit w/my husband's shirt as a cover-up (I forgot mine) so we turned tail and left. Still, overall we had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better than this !”
Reviews.Author: jurgenlison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Joule for two nights during a business trip - and found the hotel at the top end of the scale. I like W-hotels, and I truly enjoyed this one. The lobby and the rooms are gorgeous (I stayed in room 1704), and our dinner in the Charlie Palmer restaurant (accessible from the hotel lobby) was great (allbeit a bit on the expensive side :-). The service at this hotel is just wonderful (checkin, room service, and at checkout the staff noted there were 3 internet charges on my bill before I did, and removed one immediately). Negatives ? Only one, be prepared to pay time-based fees even for 1-800 calls.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLATTY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for the weekend in early April for a business conference. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The hotel is very modern and plush throughout. Great coffee table books in the rooms and lobby - too bad we didn't have time to sit and read them! Our room was fantastic - wonderful bed, very nice shower with dual showerheads, and fancy toiletries, and wonderful views. Only two complaints about the rooms - no coffeemaker in the room, and the hotel charges for wireless. (I am growing tired of paying for wireless in upscale hotels such as this one). We had several meals throughout the weekend at the hotel - ALL of the food was great. Try Charlie Palmer's for a drink - very plush. The staff was very pleasant and informative - from the bellboy to the waiters to the front desk. We were given a 2 pm checkout on Sunday, which was a nice way to end our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely The Place To Stay In Downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: lindafpitts
Reviews.Content: I planned our annual national meeting April 8-11, 2010 with 32 guest rooms and a meeting room. Here is the email I sent... Everything was fantasticâ€¦and your attention to every detail was simply without equal. Needless to say, you not only made my job easier, but it was also a very exciting and relaxing event for me and my husband! I wanted to thank each of you for going the extra mile for us...you met or exceeded our expectations at every turn! Everyone, and I mean each and everyone in our group, stated that this was their best meeting yet, and I owe it all to you! Please pass along our thanks to all the front desk, valet team and cateringâ€¦everyone behind the scenes who made our event click! YOU ARE THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “some minor flaws but worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: yafman
Reviews.Content: we are local but made a "staycation" out of my birthday celebration for a night. the romance package is worth the upgrade because it includes champagne, valet parking, chocolates and breakfast, and they even cover the bed with rose petals if/when you leave the room after check-in. if i had to nit pick i would say that a couple of lights switches and one of the phones did not work (ironic for a restored electric building) but in all honesty none of those defects affected our stay, which is probably why no one bothered to report them before; having said that a hotel of this stature should probably have better quality control so i still deducted one star from my rating. other than that the bathroom is not very private so if you want to preserve the "romance" factor you'll need to make a trip to the lobby because the ballroom level restroom is kept locked.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Joule”
Reviews.Author: TripFan045
Reviews.Content: I thought the Joule was an awesome hotel. There are a lot of pluses - the feel, the location, the pool, Charlie Palmer, the service, the workout facilities. The minor negatives are half hearted negatives. 1 - the hotel smells great but it is a little strong for me. It was almost as if the hotel lobby and elevators were wearing cologne and it was a good scent but I am a little sensitive to scents so it was a little strong for me but was nice when walking in from the street. 2 - We stayed in the Demi-Joule room and it was very small. Didn't really bother us because it was laid out well but if we had been there a number of days and spent them in the room, it would have gotten cramped. Back to the good things. The Joule has a modern feel kind of like the W but it is warmer feeling and more comforatble than the W. The pool at the Joule is amazing and is actually where they film the outdoor bar scenes for ABC's The Deep End which is the show is set in LA but is actually filmed in Dallas. Charlie Palmer (the Joule's in house restaurant) is whole other raving review waiting to happen. The food was amazing! Until recently the center of Main Street in Dallas has not been the most amazing location in Dallas to stay, but the Joule is turning into an anchor location with the downtown Nieman Marcus a couple blocks in one direction and the JFK memorial a couple blocks in the other and about 6 or 7 popular restaurants surrounding the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Work Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chitownrunt
Reviews.Content: Well let me start by stating, Tripadvisor isn't such a friendly review system. If your review is questioned you get no say in the process. My inital review was deemed a duplicate after being flagged? Not sure how that worked out, regardless I'll resubmit my review till I pass with flying colors and no red marks! I stayed at the Joule in Feb for a quick little training session I was sent to. Dallas was one of the most friendly places I've visited and this hotel is right up there with making you feel at home. The rooms are astonishing, my favorite detail in the entire room was the lights that are built into the headboard. How nice is that feature? No need to lean across the bed to turn off a nightstand light, just push the fixture back into the headboard! I stopped into Charlie Palmer for dinner, had a fantastic time there, Tommy the bartender took great care of me and the food was out of this world. New York strip was tender and the spinach side was a pefect complimant to the steak for me. Perhaps this is where my review was deemed a duplicate? My only issue I had with my trip was the Conceirge Katie. She was very shot with me when I talked to her, it was as if my research wasn't quite up to her standards of places to go. Her tone was condescending which I was off set by, not something I was expecting or enjoyed all that much. Either way, she maybe knowledgable about the city so just be warned about her delivery when talking to her. Second time the charm on my review? This hotel is wonderful, business traveler or just getting away. The entire downtown area was wonderful and I truely do look forward to trying to come back for a more leisure visit. I was treated wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “The Joule is a Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoread11
Reviews.Content: I ditto christar11's review! The Joule made our friend Michelle feel like a CELEBRITY! Michelle said she'll always remember her decadent stay at The Joule!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Heart”
Reviews.Author: christar11
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to start. Along with four other friends, I planned a getaway for a friend who has breast cancer and has recently gone through a particularly grueling surgery. I contacted the hotel just one day prior to her arrival to ask if there was something they could do to make her stay more special. Arliscia Harris contacted me immediately (within 15 minutes) and took this on as her personal project. She told me that she would do everything she could to make my friend's stay extraordinary and had already taken the liberty of upgrading her to their deluxe two story loft suite. Arliscia was in frequent contact with me over the next 24 hours, and about an hour before my friend Michelle checked in on Friday, she called me to tell me everything they had planned for her at the Joule. When she checked in, the staff greeted her by name, and everyone was wearing pink ribbon pins to celebrate her fight against breast cancer. She was in complete shock and almost started to cry immediately when they told her they were doing it just for her. When she arrived in her room, there was a beautiful bouquet of pink tulips in a gorgeous vase waiting for her (that she could take home and continue to enjoy). Arliscia and the rest of the staff had also arranged for Michelle and a friend to eat dinner in the fabulous Charlie Palmer's restaurant, where the staff was also wearing pink ribbon pins just for her. When I spoke with Michelle this morning she commented over and over how amazing the staff was at the Joule. She said that she never needed a single thing, and that everytime she would look up someone was already there to take care of her. As I am writing this, I have a combination of tears in my eyes and chills up my spine thinking of how the staff at the Joule reached out to a stranger and treated her like a queen. Amazing. I don't know how to thank them other than to remain a customer for life and to recommend that others do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: KeKeB
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed a night for his birthday. We really enjoyed it. The smell when you walked into the lobby was breathtaking...the fragrance was wonderful. The front desk staff was very nice and smiled. The valet was very courteous (but very expensive at $27 a night) We had the King room on the 6th floor. I loved the bathroom set up and the shower was huge, big enough for 4 couples (if you're into that sort of thing). The housekeeper knocked on each door and handed out complimentary chocolates and bags of ice. The doorman who brought up our bags also offered to bring us ice. They even offer a turndown service which includes Rose Petals on the bed. That night we visited the PM Lounge that's located in the basement of the hotel. It was more like a nightclub than a Lounge. It was very crowded, you could barely move, but the drinks were very good. We had fun and it was great to go to a club and not have to drive home.

Reviews.Title: “Best SPG Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: CariocaloverAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all the SPG and major Marriott hotels in Dallas and this is by far the best. 2nd best in W Victory (which is where I stay during sports events.) Everything is good and after a Thursday night at the Ritz Bar, the PM lounge is your next best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Super Modern - Great Location + Pm Lounge & Charlie Palmer”
Reviews.Author: PanamaElite
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favorite hotels in Dallas for our Staycation weekends, its literally a hotel you never have to live and can live without a car for a weekend. Which in Dallas going without a car for a weekend is a rarity. You can walk next door to iron cactus for bfast and lunch, then eat dinner at the ultra swanky Charlie Palmer. You can finish the night off by going to the basement to the PM lounge for a night cap or walk a few blocks to half a dozen other clubs.

Reviews.Title: “The Joule - A shining light in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: N575wb
Reviews.Content: For those those of you that have not stayed here you should !! The hotel is a quaint boutique upscale hotel ....part of the luxury collection. Upon check in you will notice how helpful and professional the staff is, I asked them to wrap some gifts for me, not only did they do so but they did so with a smile. The rooms well, the rooms are more like luxuriously appointed condo's than hotel rooms and suites, the furnishings are very high end and no expense was spared. Business or pleasure this is where you should stay in Dallas, the beds are comfortable and amazing, as are the amenities. The staff is there for you 24/7, I asked for extra pillows and they were there in a flash, in room dining was a treat with awesome food and service. Business or pleasure, no worries, you will be happy at this hotel. After a long day of working you return to the hotel and check out the restaurant in the hotel, Charlie Palmer's. If by now your not sold on this property, this will be sure to do the trick. Great ambiance, great food and service that is off the charts. A place where you can drink and dine, business or pleasure with no worries. You essentially have a proprty that offers it all. I tip my hat to this hotel and highly recommend it for all those traveling to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good But Act Not Together”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Eric
Reviews.Content: Ambiance--great. Staff helpfulness--great. Internet facilities---fabulous. Food--super. Room---roomy and modern. It has all the makings of a first tier hotel. But their act is not together. In a two day stay, 3 things got messed up: 1. They blew the wake-up call! Very bad! 2. They do not have phone books in rooms, and only had 3 for "check-out". Of course, other guests had all three. 3. The pay movie did not work the last night (nothing came up), but I got charged anyway, and since they screwed up the wake-up call the last morning, I did not get a chance to correct the bill while on site. What a pain !!

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: DallasDallaskitty
Reviews.Content: This place is not worth the money we spent! My husband and I stayed for my birthday and the room is plain. I was expecting something more elegant. Also, we tried to get into Club PM which is under the hotel and my husband and his two friends were denied entry! They told us we were only allowed two guests per key!! And the club was dead inside! We would have been doing them a favor by coming in! The guy who was working the door was named "CRAIG" who wouldn't let our guests in. He even looked like CRAIG from the movie "Friday" and he obviously didn't belong in the club by the way he looked!!! We got a free breakfast because of this ordeal, and the breakfast was the worst breakfast I have had ever had! Crunchy and cold. Orange juice had a bad aftertaste. Don't go here, do yourself a favor go to the "W".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and had an excellent experience. The wait staff at the pool was excellent and for a small roof top pool, it is one of the coolest ones I've seen. On the downside the sun didn't hit it until around 1pm because it was shaded by the building, but oh well, I'd rather have the sun later in the day anyway. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the downstairs bar is really cool although a little pricey. The food at the restaurant was awesome and the restaurant had a really nice look to it. The rooms were very nice too, and a decent size for a downtown hotel. The only negative was that the champagne glasses were spotty and I had to call down for some fresh ones. They sent them up right away, apologized profusely, and offerred me some dessert from the restaurant to go along with the champagne. In the end it turned a negative into a big plus for me. The workout area was also really nice, with brand new nice equipment, a stereo, and an HDTV. Overall, I had a great experience and next time I stay in downtown Dallas, I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: huckleberryts
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stopped in for a weekend getaway from the children and what a wonderful experience The Joule is! The only gripe we had was the pool and that was just because we didn't feel like we belonged there judging the age of the crowd out there. Instead the following day we just went up a little earlier then everybody else and enjoyed the pool. The pool is a sight to see, they have a great bar up there as well! We were told by some people to try out the house car for our dinner reservations, sure glad we did. They have an Escalade and it was nice having the chance to just observe the city and not worry about how to get to the restaurants. We had two drivers for the night we ate out, Craig and Brendan both were great at entertaining us on the trip to and from the hotel and explaining the life of downtown. Craig seemed to have quite a bit of knowledge of the downtown history and recommended a book titled Dallas Landmarks that my wife picked up for us. If you stay here make good use of the House Car service, it's a GREAT service that shouldn't be missed out on here. We'll be back again, the room was outstanding and all the staff were friendly and caring toward our stay making sure everything is going smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: pudgeray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Joule for an extended amount of time throughout the summer. When deciding on where to stay for my training I was looking for a clean, upper scale hotel with exceptional service. Well, I picked the right one. EVERYONE I met there was extraordinarily nice to me. Some of the few that stand out would be Danielle, Jessica, and Katie at the front desk. Also Brendan and Craig were the best, they would bend over backwards to accommodate me. I would recommend this hotel to anyone; it is clean, luxurious and has out of this world service. - Mr. Ray

Reviews.Title: “does not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: txex1996
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the brilliant reviews on The Joule, I selected it for my wedding night. My husband and I booked a suite for three nights. When I booked the suite, I advised the hotel that this would be for my wedding. I again advised them when I checked in. The big white dress later that night was a dead giveaway. What I received is exactly what was listed for the room. Nothing more, nothing less. The impeccable treatment such as thoughtful notes, champagne, or other niceties were no where to be found. All in all, this hotel was nothing special with a high price tag. My stay at the Magnolia around the corner for the preceding two nights was far more pleasant for $150 less a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not "Luxury Collection" worthy, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumMember
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Joule on Starwood points. Check in was easy, and they upgraded our room, probably due to my Starwood status. The room was very clean and modern and included an ipod dock and nice flat screen TV. The bathroom sink/mirror was really more about form than function, and the sink was slow to drain...I always think this is gross. The towels were nice and plush, as were the robes. A full size ironing board and iron were in the room. The bed, pillows and bed linens were great - very comfortable, and the dark curtains took care of any downtown lights when we went to bed. This hotel really reminded me of a W Hotel. I have stayed in some of the Starwood luxury collection hotels (e.g. St. Regis) and this does NOT compare to that in any way. If you like traditional luxury, this is not the hotel for you. Try one of the Rosewood hotels in town instead. The Joule was very trendy and scene-y. We went out to the pool and found no place to sit in the sun, so we ended up sitting at the bar. The place was packed with the young tatooed and siliconed variety (it felt like Vegas). We noticed that the bartenders friends were hanging out - clearly not guests at the hotel - which was slightly irritating, but would have been more so if I had payed to stay here. It isn't right when guests cant get a seat by the pool because local friends have filled the place up. If you do go up to the pool, skip the mojitos. They were awful. More like sprite and rum. The valet service was lackluster. They were slow and it is just a bad set up because there really isn't a pull through, you just pull over on the side of the street. In the valets defense, there was a large party innundating them all at once, so this could have contributed to the below average service. But at $27/day, you'd think they'd be able to hire additional staff. If you like a trendy scene, like to do the club thing, then this place might be for you. Otherwise, you may want to check elsewhere. Also note that I DO like some of the W Hotels out there, so I'm not a total stick in the mud who only wants the Ritz Carlton scene. I just think you can do better in Dallas for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: auntilalex
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous get away for the weekend. I only live about 3 miles away from the Joule and felt a world away. The room was fabulous as was the service. Went to the pool twice and had the best time. Awesome service especially from Brandon the bartender who remembered me on the second visit. Had a fabulous breakfast via room service wich was delivered in record time. When coming back to the room Sunday from the pool happened to be on the elevator with the food and beverage manager, I believe his name was Jason last name starts with a C (can't) remember, he asked both me and my friend how our service had been both Charlie Palmer's the night before and room service. He was especially concerned with the time room service took (not long). What a treat to have someone so concened about service!!! I will be back, and soon!! TOTAL THUMBS UP!!!!! I Love this hotel!!! Sarah Cross

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Night!”
Reviews.Author: AFields620
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Joule for our wedding night. Everything about our stay was perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful, even having the breakfast we requested ready at 5 AM! Our favorite part was the Charlie Palmer restaurant. Our waiter was excellent and the chef sent complimentary appetizers and dessert. We'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Worth a Try”
Reviews.Author: JetSetNY22
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I went so I addressed some of the service issues beforehand. My boyfriend and I stayed there for his birthday and I wanted everything to be perfect. Jessica, the front desk manager, was great. Their new GM is aware of the service issues they have had and he is working to turn it around. We were treated very well. They had a bottle of champagne,yummy chocolates and a cheese platter in the room. We stayed in one of the lofts and initially had some temperature issues but they were addressed quickly.
