The room was fantastic. Well decorated, sleek and modern. They have the top of the line Beautyrest mattress which was really comfortable. Two of the three bathrooms had huge walk in showers and double showerheads. The owner is an art collector so the lobby was decorated with pieces from his own personal collection. There is a sustainable energy theme in the hotel and Jessica and Brandon gave us the background story. If you go ask the front desk about it. Charlie Palmers is connected to the hotel and it is excellent. The sommelier at Charlie Palmers, Brandon was awesome. He coordinated with NOKA Chocolates for a private wine and chocolate pairing on Saturday afternoon. The pool area was packed and we had a cabana reserved for us. The pool is small but they keep it very cool and refreshing. It had a mini-Vegas poolside vibe. Their nightclub, PM, manages the pool area. We had opportunity to go to PM that night as well. We got the red carpet treatment. They had initially reserved us a table but when we got there it had been given away. They apologized profusely and comped us all our drinks. I would say that this place is worth a chance despite the reviews. The staff seems very willing to hear feedback and make it better. We had a lovely, relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: Kitten09
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas however we both needed a "getaway "without the time and stress of going out of town! So instead of going out of town we planned a special Saturday and Sunday at the Hotel Joule in Dallas, Tx. From the time we drove up to the Valet at the hotel and were greeted by the amazing staff until we left the hotel the experience was one that I will never forget. It was EXACTLY what we both needed, to relax and just enjoy ourselves fully without any stress. The attention we received the entire time we were at the hotel was excpetional and I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants personal attention. I've already recommended the hotel to co-workers and friends that plan on celebrating their anniversaries at the Joule!! Thanks to all the staff that helped us relax and enjoy ourselves! Sincerely, Shana Uptown in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTexasTraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many 5-star hotels, and the Joule is in the top 2 for sure. (We are VERY picky.) We were only scheduled to stay one night, but it was so incredible, we stayed another night. The room had a sexy contemporary decor. Very Romantic....GO!!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: eljaniovich
Reviews.Content: I'm quite shocked at the inadequate service the Joule / Charlie Palmer restaraunt has. I went there for lunch to enjoy their advertised 'lobster corndogs'. I asked the maitre'd if it could be served at the pool and they said 'yes', but it would have to be ordered from the pool. My friend and I went to the 10th floor pool deck and ordered the corndogs along with 2 expensive drinks. After 30 minutes, we ordered 2 more expensive drinks. Finally, after 1 hr of waiting, we cancelled the order for the 'lobster corndogs' and left. We were told some lame excuse that they didn't know what was going on - 'normally they are so quick about delivering the food'. For a 4-star hotel, it has 1-star service. Absolutely ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE UR MONEY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maymay81
Reviews.Content: Well it started off BAD within 10 mins we had went to the pool where we find about 5 young ladies workin and just stood there looking like we where not even there, so I was like excuse me can I get a drink. After my first drink we had to flag down a girl to ask for another as the pool area was not busy maybe 6 other people so ni reason for service to be that bad. Then I went up to bar to close tab again just standing there it took ten mins, then the manager of the pool and club pm was there and was very friendly offered us free drinks and help but I rejected I no longer wanted to be around that. This hotel does not have ice machines you have to call for ice well we called so we could have our own drink in room well lets say it NEVER CAME!!!! That evening we went down to the club PM which is in hotel very unfriendly and it took us for ever to get in and if your staying at hotel it is suppose to not be a problem to get in YEAH RIGHT!!!! ok Saturday we ate at Charlie Palmers resturant in hotel food was good but service was so bad I could get better service at MC Donalds than this supper bad. Then Saturday evening after having night of fun on town came back to order room service it took 45 mins. to get ONE sandwhich I had to call and ck on it and there are slow and the service is so bad and the managers know which makes it WORSE... Please do not waste ur money go to ZAZAS, The W, or the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not quite a Luxury Collection”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: Very trendy design at this one year old boutique near Neiman Marcus in downtown. There is not a club lounge as there is at some Lux Collection properties. The rooms are well appointed as would be expected at a hotel that wants to charge $250/night. We had a package that included a bottle of champagne (Charlie Palmer sparkling) and also included breakfast for two with complimentary parking. There is a very nice work out room on the 9th floor, and pool on the 10th floor. The pool area is quite small and has a hopping bar. Minors are prohibited from the pool area after 6 pm because it's a scene, especially on the weekends. If you are into clubbing, this is a good place to have a drink. They also have a night club downstairs called PM that is also very popular. The elevators are not locked off or monitored in the evenings, so anyone can jump on and ride up to a floor of their choosing whether they are staying in the property or not. The rooms on the 10th floor can be inconvenienced by the noise of people in the hallways going to the pool bar on 10. I would not recommend anyone stay on this floor. The lobby is very nice and we had a couple glasses of wine while getting hit on by two older women who had flown in from Anchorage to attend an Eric Clapton concert. Not exactly what you would normally find in the lobby of a Luxury Collection hotel, but kind of fun none the less. The hotel restaurant is Charlie Palmer and while we didn't care to eat a steak, it has received excellent reviews in the Dallas press and I'm sure is top notch. We thought the staffing was a little untrained. They tried hard, but it's definitely not a 5 star experience. I had a problem at the desk when reviewing my bill and while the gal helping me got everything taken care of, some buttinskee from the restaurant was interjecting his comments about why I had a tax and gratuity added to my bill for a "complimentary" breakfast. He was a little over the top, but I'm sure he'll not be there long with his demeanor. Furthermore, the room service breakfast was not acceptable we didn't say anything but it really wasn't that good. So so at best. Had we paid for it and it wasn't included in the inflated package price we paid, I would have quickly called and asked that the food be re-cooked and brought up. The presentation was plain, very plain and it took way to long to set it up once they got it to the room. All in all, it's a modern trendy boutique hotel, well appointed as you would expect at a Luxury Collection property, but it is definitely geared to a younger party crowd that would enjoy the hip modern vibe of the rooms and wouldn't care about so-so service, especially when they are getting loaded at the poolside bar. We normally stay at another property in downtown Dallas with impeccable service and always on the Gold floor where there are complimentary food presentations throughout the day, private check-in and an honor bar. We pay $139 at that hotel which is far less than the Joule and with incredible rooms that were just redone last year even though it's of a more traditional design, so we won't stay again at the Joule, but it was an interesting experience and our only real observation was the service level and quality just wasn't quite up to snuff with the staff. If you get an absolutely ROCK bottom price for the Joule it might be worth a stay, but otherwise there are other alternatives close by with impeccable standards and service. I'm a Platinum SPG member so I'm in and out of a lot of Starwood Properties and while this was entertaining for a night, I would not have wanted to stay here longer than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Off Key”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl8008
Reviews.Content: Cons: Service is terrible!! Maybe I just had a bad experience but I was throughly disappointed in this hotel. It seemed as if they had the "summer staff" on duty. The valet just stood right next to me while I struggled with my luggage. He did not offer to help in any way. Once I was at the desk, I still was not offered any help with getting all my luggage to my room. That evening, I placed my room service order on my door well before the requested time of midnight. I only ordered a pot of coffee for 7am. After waiting 45 minutes, I finally opened my door and realized they didn't even pick up the card. It was still hanging on the door handle. After calling down to the desk, they did not even give a simple apology. Maybe I'm just spoiled, but I travel frequently and I have never recieved such poor service from an "upscale" hotel. Pros: The rooms were very clean and nice. I did have breakfast at the restaurant and the food was great. The service I recieved at the restaurant was also wonderful. They were prompt, polite, and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “A Definate Go To For A Dallas Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: katymartin24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Joule on the weekend of May21st through May 23rd. The hotel was wonderful but more than the hotel â€“ the service was impeccable. I first found the Joule online and wanted to stay there just from the photos on the main Web site page. It just looked amazing. I called to make a reservation and was helped by one of the kindest men ever. He took down all my information and even made sure we had a great room with a view. He completely made me feel at ease and even went to the extent of trying to get our dinner reservations out of the way so we would not have to worry about it when we got to Dallas. I cannot remember his name â€“ but he was fantastic. My boyfriend called up earlier on in the week and told Katie, a concierge, it was our anniversary. We wanted to go to the Byron Nelson golf tournament and we didnâ€™t really want to drive. She mentioned she might have a contact who could take us to the golf event. She lined up the driver and it was perfect. The driver was also one of the nicest men ever â€“ it was lovely. For my anniversary gift, Katie set up for us to have a massage even though you guys do not actually have a spa area. She told us just to be ready in our robes and someone would come to get us in our room. The masseuses were running late â€“ but it did not matter. The robes at the Joule are to die for. I was already relaxed and we were in no rush. However, the heads up was given to us by a very nice woman on the phone and she also asked if we needed anything else. It was quiet when we walked into the makeshift â€œspaâ€� and smelled wonderfully and I literally had one of the best massages I have ever had. It was so relaxing. I was in heaven. What a wonderful anniversary gift! The man who consistently brought our room service was hilarious. He was funny and helpful and even ensured I had all the items I had ordered before he left. The coffee was wonderful, but more so, we thought the burger we got from room service and the Caesar salad was better than a restaurant served items. It was just great. The shower was refreshing and the hair dryer was the best I have ever used. I can assure you the next time we come to Dallas, you will be our home away from home. Please find out who helped me make my reservation and thank them. Tell Katie she truly made my anniversary weekend a dream come true. Tell our room service man he was great and very gracious to bring us everything we needed and have Katie pass along our thanks to the driver from Friday. Thank you again for having us at the Joule. You have a wonderful hotel and it is gorgeous from the inside out â€“ but what will truly bring guests back is your service and attitude towards the customer. I felt as if I was right at home and smiles were abundant. Three things out of the ordinary that we did not like was the area where you check in. We were a bit confused when walking in but found our way back to the back. A sign or someone walking you to the desk might be nice. The second was there were no hooks to hang our towels. I am all about saving the Earth and preventing the staff from washing my towels each time they clean our room â€“ but there was no place for me to hang my towel. Thirdly, I would love for one hotel to step up and offer free Internet in the rooms. We are at a time where I do not think staying in an upper class hotel such as the Joule should also require me to pay $15-$25 to use the Internet for 24 hours in my room. Either include this within the rate for the room or go above and beyond and offer it for free. You could steal a ton of business from not only hotels such as Doubletree, the W and Westin hotels but all other upscale hotels. Each of my friends and I are waiting for one hotel to offer this amenity and then we will be exclusive to them for our stays. Yet, no one has stepped up to the plate to do so. I ask the Joule start the free Internet craze and increase your room occupancy tenfold.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: baypoint1
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Dallas and this hotel is the new Mansion on Turtle Creek. I stay in hotels all over the world and this hotel is up their with the best. I have stayed her three times since the opening and all three have been perfect. The attention to detail is fantastic. The rooms, service, food, and (Cadillac SUV'S) make this the best hotel in Dallas. Take it from someone who stayed at the Mansion since 1983 this place is tops!

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: TXWV
Reviews.Content: The attention to detail at this hotel is superb from the moment you step out of your car with the valet, the staff is aware of who you are, your name and they go out of their way to make you feel like you are a guest in their home. I traveled to Dallas with several different family members with different taste & needs and we were all completely satisfied with our stay. The Joule is within walking distance of The Majestic Theatre and several bars and restaurants. In addition their in house restaurant- Charlie Palmers is very good and the service is just as sweet as the hotel. The pool is spectacular. That is all I am going to say, this is a must see for yourself! I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone and the price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrmNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a short business trip with meetings in Dallas downtown. This was part of the Starwood Luxury Collection, but having been dissappointed many times before, I did not expect much. Turns out I was way wrong. This was probably one of the best Starwod properties I have stayed in the last year. The hotel is about 40 minutes from DFW airport in downtown Dallas. Check in staff was extremely courteous and actually escorted me to the elevators (instead of saying "turn left, then right..." as the front deks often does). The front deks area is not huge, but has a farily open seating and meeting place. The room was spacious enough, with a big glass wall on the outside, a 42" flat screen TV, and terrific lighting arrangements that allowed you to adjust the brightness in various parts of the room. The bed was very comfy. Everything was clean and well maintained. The bath and toilet were divided into two separate rooms, and the sink area was separate. This can be useful for couples staying in the room. There was a complimentary bottle of water, and toiletries were top notch. There was a nice collection of magazines in a rack next to the toilet bowl! Internet cost the usual $12 to $14 a day. Just one downside. The area around the hotel isn't exactly swanky. There are a lot of office buildings, but the place really seems to die down after 5 PM. There is a Neiman Marcus and a decent Mexican restaurant next door, but there's also a boarded up building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Design, BAD PILLOWS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Prospect_Park_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business as I am a big fan of the hotel's designer, A. Tihany. Design of the lobby and rooms was chic and sophisticated. Restaurant in the lobby is a Charlie Palmer and very much enjoyed the breakfast, lunch and dinner I had. Everything about the hotel was great until I tried to sleep. The feather pillows were absolutely horrible and I MAYBE got 4 hours sleep. Next day I asked for foam pillows and they weren't much better. If you can bring your own pillows, stay here. If not, beware!!! John NYC

Reviews.Title: “Joule has become one of my favorite hotels in the US”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and for pleasure, and staying at the Joule reminded this weary traveler that traveling CAN lead to excellent surprises and discoveries. I've stayed there twice now - once in November, once in December. Both experiences have been among my top experiences at any hotel. The first time I was in an upgraded room, and the second time I stayed in a room that was more of a suite, with a sitting area and jacuzzi tub. Both rooms were a joy to stay in -- immaculate decor, extensive light dimmers throughout, $200+ professional hair dryers (the nicest I've ever used in a hotel), complimentary water bottles in the room, rain shower heads, unique coffee table-type books to read in each room and in the lobby, an umbrella for guests to use in each room, etc. It was too cold to swim in the pool or drink at the bar at the pool, but this area looks like it would be a major draw in the warm months. The gym was by far the cleanest, biggest, and most well equipped hotel gym I've ever visited (minus the spa gyms in Vegas hotels -- not really comparable). Charlie Palmer is a home run restaurant, with a hopping bar scene on weekends, fabulous dining fare, and an exceptional breakfast menu. With only minor exceptions, the service was top-notch and went beyond our expectations. Once we had to wait longer than acceptable (30 minutes) on a car to come out of valet parking (other guests who called for their cars later than we did got their cars before us). On the positive side, though, we were greeted by name throughout our stay, assisted with dining reservations, and treated exceptionally well in all other interactions. Hotel staff dress well in pin-striped suits and other dressy professional wear and seem to take pride in their jobs. The downtown part of Dallas where the hotel is located is enjoying a bit of a renaissance, it appears, with more businesses opening but still some empty storefronts. Neiman Marcus is less than a block from the hotel, and several restaurants are in that same block. The Sunday brunch at Iron Cactus was better than expected (and a great deal at around $14 a person, I think it was), and we ate a pricey but excellent foodie lunch at the Dallas Fish Market (less than a block from the hotel) and LOVED it. Count this hotel among my top choices in the US. I would gladly create a reason to go back to Dallas just to stay at the Joule again.

Reviews.Title: “The Joule is a Jewel of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissKandMrJ
Reviews.Content: 3 nights at this luxurious hotel with my other half. This was the first leg of our trip as we were passing through on the way to Cabo (Mexico). When arriving at the hotel, the taxi door was opened for us and bags collected from the trunk and the next time they were seen was in the room. The doorman radioed ahead to the reception desk to let them know we had arrived. The hotel lobby is very grand. There is a wheel near the reception desk and lots of seating. Also there is 2 PCs for internet usage, should you want. The very friendly receptionist was welcoming, greeted us and took us up to our room. She showed us around our room, we had been upgraded. The room was very stylish. As an extra special touch they had laid out chocolates for us. Despite the set back that one of my cases did not arrive the hotel could not have been more accommodating. They contacted the airline and arranged for it to be dropped off. Whilst providing the house car to take us to the mall to buy essentials. The pool on the roof was awesome. It extends over the edge of building. The side of the pool is glass and you can look down to the street below. There were several cabanas and various seating areas and also a bar. We had decided to go the bar known as the Ghost Bar of the sister hotel 'W' and the hotel very kindly offered to take us in the house car. They had also provided us with a party key to access the party where Grand Master Flash was DJ. The key allowed us to cut queue and head straight up to the party on 33rd floor. Charlie Palmer's the restaurant in the hotel is amazing. The food was simply delicious. Whilst sitting in the bar waiting for our table the bartender made drinks especially for us. He was was friendly and even gave us drinks on the house! The menu had a lot of variety, so something for everyone. When we had finished our main course, the waiter brought over complimentary coffees and a selection of deserts and also chocolates. The atmosphere was relaxed but smart and the service was excellent. On the last day the hotel had laid out a complimentary breakfast buffet as the restaurant was closed. This was the usual pastries and tea/coffee/orange juice selection. A lovely touch. All the people in the hotel were very friendly and knew us by name! I would recommend this hotel. Truly service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: hefleycatz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-end get away for our anniversary at the Joule. We were very impressed with the service and attention to detail. We were upgraded from a regular deluxe room to a Loft Suite and even received a bottle of champagne. All I can say is.....AMAZING. Charlie Palmers is a wonderful restaurant and also supplys room service. Staff is incredible. Danielle and Gregory were always there for whatever we needed. Truly a luxury week-end.

Reviews.Title: “Nice otel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: maigabsar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Joule for two nights, and the hotel itself is quite beautiful. Our room was very nice as well. However, the service is not where near other luxury collection hotels, but more on the line of a Motel 6. The cleaning services "forgot" to make up our room, and did not replenish the soap or shampoo. Furthermore, they left us only one bath towel and forgot to remove all their cleaning supplies from our room. I did complain to management and they appeased me with some Starwood points. It is just very hard to fathom such poor service in a hotel that claims to be a luxury hotel. They have a great deal of work to do, so be weary if you book this place now. I imagine most of the kinks will be worked out soon, or this place won't last long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some kinks need to be worked out”
Reviews.Author: McSmarty01
Reviews.Content: Went to Joule for anniversary get-away. Brand new hotel which is nice since so many hotels do not update once they are a little older. Very contemporary hotel but classy. We considered Ritz and Mansion on Turtle Creek but happily choice Joule. Service is hit or miss. They had free bottle of wine and chocolates in our room for our anniversary which was nice but I had to ask 3 times for ice bucket (it is small hotel so there are no ice machines on the floors). When I checked out they double billed for the room (once in my name and once in my wife's) and the guy at desk said they had had problems with that happening. There is Charlie Palmer restaurant in hotel but is not owned by hotel. Charlie Palmer cooks the room service menu but it is different menu than restaurant and didn't look as good (no foie gras). We ordered take out from Charlie Palmer and they even provided us plates and silverware. This was nice because we got the food we wanted, didn't have to worry about it being cold and got to watch UT kick Missouri's [----]. Location is in middle of downtown but lots of activities close by. Check out Iron Cactus for a drink - they have 3rd story rooftop bar that is really nice if weather is good. Also for the ladies one of Dallas' best spas (Sedona - lady's only) is across the street but make sure and get appointment in advance as my wife couldn't get same day appointment on Saturday. The hotel can arrange for in room or couples massage from Sedona. Also try brunch at Bread Winner's Cafe - just a short 3 miles away. We had dinner at Nobu which is in Crescent Court which was really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience but...”
Reviews.Author: mswsxy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with an amazing rooftop pool and lounge area. I would have nothing bad to say if I had not realized when I got home that the valet (or somebody with access to our car in the valet lot), had stolen a couple of items from my trunk. The staff at the hotel and the parking company (ACE parking) are working hard to rectify the situation, but at $27/night for parking one would hope that her car was more secure than it apparently was. So, one word of caution; empty your car entirely when parking in their valet lot.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: eloquentlight
Reviews.Content: This was, simply the best hotel experience we have ever had. My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary. Upon check in, they knew (and remembered!) our names, what we liked, everyone congratulated us on our anniversary! Upon check in our room was not ready, but they offered to hold our luggage and let us swim in their pool. The pool! It was a salt water pool on the 12th floor that juts out over Main Street in Dallas. The service there was exceptional, the area was very clean and very well maintained. The concierge came and gave us our room key when our room was ready. The room was immaculate - superbly decorated, super clean, and there was a complimentary bottle of champagne for us, with truffles and a lovely note from the manager. The room was superb! Large, quiet, excellent! The room service was wonderful - the food was great, and the service was, again, exceptional. Stay here - it's expensive, but absolutely worth it - we plan on returning next anniversary!

HotelInfo.Name: The Joule, Dallas
HotelInfo.Address: 1530 Main Street, Dallas, TX 75201
